Reviews.Title: “Best location for families wanting to stay downtown and be close to Stanley Park!”
Reviews.Author: yqu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at TSS twice now with my wife and two children and we'll be heading back next year again. Location is fantastic being super close to Stanley Park for kids, kiddy corner to Safeway for diapers, and short walk for shopping. I recommend TSS to all our friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Anthony M
Reviews.Content: My family just recently stayed in the Times Square Suites hotel and it turned out to be one of the best hotel stays that we have ever had, the great location, the wonderful staff and the convenience of having a kitchen and laundry available made our stay perfect. I was going to stay at one of the big chain hotels when I came across this gem and boy am I glad I did. We had a corner room on the Robson side and found it to be not as noisy as I had read about, that would not have bothered us any way as we like to people watch as we sip on a drink. We now have a home away from home on our next visit to Vancouver! We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but normal precautions apply”
Reviews.Author: Ellie M
Reviews.Content: First, the awesomeness: staff was so welcoming; suite was spotless; and the location is fabulous (park, harbor, safeway, whole foods, so many restaurants all nearby). I would just say that visitors to this hotel (or any other hotel anywhere, but especially in Vancouver where bed bugs are kind of a problem) should check their rooms very carefully. They do have mattress covers, a staff trained to clean for bed bugs, very concerned management, and apparently no history of bed bugs. However, even hotels with perfect track records can have the occasional bed bug incident. I found a few bites on my body after the first night and noticed some dark streaks on the otherwise pristine bed skirts (could be a sign of bed bugs). So, I'd say that Times Square probably does more to prevent bed bugs than most hotels, but each traveler should take precautions (e.g., leave luggage on a table or in the bathtub, use the suites' dryer to apply heat to all belongings before leaving). Just google bed bug to see how to prevent the spread of these critters, and bring a bed bug repellent spray with you to every hotel you visit. Safe travels!

Reviews.Title: “Times Square Suites - like going home again.”
Reviews.Author: corbo7
Reviews.Content: We have just completed our second stay at Times Square Suites in 2 years, this time in a 1 bedroom and den suite. We requested a bright, yet quiet room, and that is what we gladly received on arrival. The location is fantastic, being close to Denman St restaurants, supermarket, Stanley Park, public transport and Robson St. The staff here are always helpful friendly and professional. We love staying at TSS when in Vancouver BC, and look forward to our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: d105raynee
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location for it's right by Stanley park, short distance to the harbor and to English Bay. We walked everywhere or took the ferry. Room was nice and staff were helpful. Next time I'm in Vancouver, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: Sherry C
Reviews.Content: Truly a wonderful experience, the staff went out of there way to help me. My husband was in a wheelchair and I had a broken shoulder, the staff came to my assistance whenever needed. The one bedroom suite we stayed in had everything we could ask for. My only negative comment would be that the tv in the bedroom should be update to a flat screen, but seriously would still strongly recommend this facility. Bravo to the outstanding staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Close to Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: LilbearSeattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance to Stanley Park and many other downtown amenities. Overall, the accommodations were nice with a functional kitchen. There is a grocery store across the street for easy shopping and a great way to save some money for meals. The only draw back was that the wireless internet was terrible. Many times it was difficult to even check e-mail. This was frustrating but luckily we were visiting for fun and did not need good internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for families”
Reviews.Author: Nicole Y
Reviews.Content: We booked on short notice but the staff was more than helpful and even suggested (rightfully so) that we would be happier in a larger suite than the one originally booked. The front desk staff was very friendly. The suite was very clean with every amenity we needed. The location is wonderful within walking distance of almost everything. The off-street covered parking was great, too. I would highly recommend this property to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: mere50
Reviews.Content: Just as good as the reviews suggested. Clean, friendly, grat location and the apartment has everything we needed to feel like we are at home. In a regular hotel you often cannot relax and heat up a Cinnabon to go with your coffee. In fact sometimes you can't even make a coffee in your room. Here you can roast a turkey if you want!! Or not, as there are cafes and top class eating establishments right there. And for kiwis, there is great coffee in the next block at Milano so no need to frequent Starbucks on the ground flor of the building. Milano has three grinders so you can choose the fresh roasted blend and the barista makes GREAT trim flat whites. Right by Stanley Park and on the major transport routes. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Night on the Town”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: We drove in from south of Vancouver to spend an evening out for dinner, the Symphony, and some Downtown atmosphere; a mini getaway. The secure, underground parking (price included) was the first good sign. We were greeted warmly, and were up in our room (facing north towards the mountains, on the quiet side, away from the street) before we knew it. The room (1 bedroom suite) was spotlessly clean, and had all the amenities (2 flat screen TVs, wireless internet, full kitchen and nice living area) that we could want. What a location! We walked to dinner and the Symphony, and strolled lazily back to the hotel afterwards. Security is stressed at the hotel, and we appreciate that. It was a Saturday night, but it was very quiet. We would recommend the Time Square Suites Hotel to anyone who wants a terrific stay in Vancouver. We'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Maelstrom88
Reviews.Content: You are hard pressed to find a better location in the West End than that offered by the Times Square Suites Hotel. The location at the intersection of Robson St. & Denman St. provides great access to shopping, restaurants, Coal Harbour, English Bay and Stanley Park. The hotel is very clean and well maintained! I stayed in the one bedroom suite and found it be very pleasant. It was really more along the lines of staying in a nicely furnished one bedroom condo than a hotel room. The Times Square Suites Hotel offers excellant value and had now become my preferred place to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: PLP713
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 2 nights. It was peaceful, relaxing and close to so many places to eat. The staff were on the ball and friendly. The suite was clean and comfortable. We had some family come for dinner one of the nights and it felt like home. I would definitely stay here again. A rare find in the big city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always!!”
Reviews.Author: bethie
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Times Square Suites as we do every year on our trip to Canada - we would not consider staying anywhere else!. The suites are well appointed, incredibly clean, comfortable and warm. The suites are close to everything and if you need to get somewhere else very close to transport. The staff are extremely helpful - nothing is ever too much trouble for them. Great to see that the TV's have been replaced during the past year with new flat screen models. If you are going to Vancouver definately stay here - you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place to stay in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Marlon R
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Time Square Suites was an excellent overall experience. The staff and service was exceptionally friendly and accommodating to our requests. An incredibly clean and comfortable room. Well appointed with a full kitchen and washer/dryer. And quiet, very little noise from adjoining rooms or street. Convenient location just on the corner of Denman and Robson, close to a Safeway and Capers/ Whole Foods, and several very good eateries. Literally across the street from Kintaro Ramen (highly recommended and just above a Starbucks (for your caffeine needs). Futhermore, the staff and service was exceptionally friendly and accommodating to our requests. They even made the effort to contact us regarding an item we had purposely left behind (a small set of tools) in case we had accidentally discarded it. I couldn't recommend them enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Sharon678
Reviews.Content: Had second stay in six months at Times Square Suites -- excellent location in West End of Vancouver, within walking distance to Stanley Park, Robson Street shopping (including two nearby grocery stores), downtown and Coal Harbor. Staff very accommodating at check in and check out, and housekeeping services very thorough. Suites are clean and spacious, with all the appliances you need (cable TV, full kitchen, washer/dryer) for a comfortable stay (although bedroom TVs could use updating, but a minor quibble). Definitely a continued "go-to" place whenever we visit Vancouver! Sharon, New York City

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Annette G
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed for two nights at the TSSH in a one bedroom with den (extra bed) and found the suites to be spacious, comfortably appointed with pleasant decor, including a very well equipped full kitchen. Everything was clean and in good repair which made it much more agreeable than is often the case. The only reason I gave the sleep quality rating of 4 instead of 5 is because of there being a super firm mattress in the main bedroom; I like firm, but this was a little harder than was comfortable for me. Really enjoyed having the nice LG flat screen TV with a DVD player and a decent sound system for radio or CD's. Complimentary WiFi was a nice perk, and we appreciated that there was a phone number to call 24 hours a day to resolve connectivity issues (FYI - Skype video calls show as suspicious upload/downloads and can get your log in temporarily banned). They also have a secure parking garage off the alley that is well lit, with large stalls to fit most all vehicles easily. You do pay extra for parking, but it's worth it for the convenience as street parking is metered and heavily enforced. One doesn't need a car, but there are so many "must see" sights in the area, you will benefit by having transport. Location is also highly desirable if you prefer the streets to be a little bit quieter than the main shopping / business district. While being just a few blocks away from center, you will find coffee shops, grocery stores, bistros, cafes, and numerous other comforts outside your door; with a lot less noise! Plus, you are located 2 blocks from the entrance to Stanley Park; one of the most beautiful parks that also includes a wonderful aquarium, restaurants, gardens, and lovely walking, biking, driving routes. The hotel does rent bikes, helmets, etc. too. Last but not least, the staff were all very pleasant, helpful, and accommodating! Really appreciated their contacting us ahead of time to make sure we would not need special arrangements for late arrival as their office closes at 11:00 PM. Highly recommend this hotel just on the considerate, friendly, and personable desk staff! Will definitely be returning and recommending to friends.

Reviews.Title: “in walking distance to most of downtown.”
Reviews.Author: judymichael40
Reviews.Content: we stayed here last over grey cup weekend. parking is around the back and underneath the building. a code is needed to enter the elevator, thus one feels quite safe. the units are apartment-like, with a dining area off the kitchen. our unit looked out onto the corner of robson and denman streets, so it was fun watching all the comings and goings. we were there with 4 other people and had our choice of eating in for breakfasts or a number of choices nearby. a safeway and liquor store is 1/2 block away. we walked along the seawall to have lunch in gastown. and walked back from b.c place along robson. the beds are comfortable, the units clean, and the check- in staff are friendly, professional and helpful. the prices are very reasonable. i give this place a big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A night away !!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a night away ,even though we only live in Abbotsford an hour away we felt like we had a very enjoyable and relaxing weekend. When we entered the apartments we were greated by very friendly and pleasant staff. We felt that the building had great security. When we entered our suite,it was so perfect. It was very clean and had everything you would need to make your stay pleasant. I was very impressed by entering the room to here soft music playing on the T.V. it was such a nice touch. The bed was so comfotable and cozy that we had a great night seep. We would recommend this place to anyone we know who is planning a trip to Vancouver. We had such an enjoyable time.The location is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: paul Joseph b
Reviews.Content: Super place, amazing location just blocks from Stanley Park and the best urban beaches in North America. Staff was very helpful, let us park our car there all day after we'd checked out! Loved it and will return asap.

Reviews.Title: “A nice home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Workingmomof4
Reviews.Content: Time square hotel was a nice little getaway. I was impressed by the staff that were very friendly. The rooms were clean and most everything was terrific. The soap dispenser didn't work very well, but I brought my own supplies. The location is good with Safeway across the street and most everything in walking distance including the beach, stanley park, and transit. It was a bit tricky to find the parkade, so go down the alleyway and look for the signs. It was nice to have the big screen tv, fireplace and the kitchenette. I'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Our new "go to" hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: robinsegg
Reviews.Content: We lived in Vancouver for 16 years and since leaving 14 years ago, we've stayed in many different downtown hotels. This trip (end of January/beginning of February 2012) we decided to try the Times Square and couldn't be happier. It's quiet. The location is excellent - close to Stanley Park, within a 10 minute walk of any type of food at a wide price range, grocery store and liquor store across the street, bus routes outside your door, roomy suites with well-equipped kitchens. Rooms are clean, linens very nice, it's "all good". Rates are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Caroline K
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable. Only a block away from Stanley Park's Lost Lagoon, this is the perfect location for outdoor enthusiasts who want to combine being right downtown Vancouver with the beauty and tranquility of Stanley Park. You can rent bikes just across the road from the hotel and spend hours biking thru the wonderful trails. The kitchen is fully stocked with real attention to detail. There was nothing lacking, from nice dishes to pots and pans, and all the necessary appliances. The restaurants in the area are fabulous but with a large supermarket opposite, you can easily prepare all your meals in your own suite. Would definitely recommended the Times Square Suites to anyone visiting Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Spacious accomodation”
Reviews.Author: 932Wolf932
Reviews.Content: Have stayed the second time at Times Square Suites, and although I normally never write reviews, this place deserves it. Very spacious suites, very convenient located to both downtown Vancouver, but also located only 2 blocks from Stanley Park. This park is a 4 x 4 km natural British Columbia rainforest on a peninsula in the middle of urban Vancouver. Excellent for walking, biking, strolling, has even a lake, many hiking paths, a beautiful aquarium, and shoreline walkways all around, with great views of the city`s skyline. After a long day of business meetings the perfect park to catch fresh air and go for a walk. In the other direction,Times Square is right at the end of a long strip of restaurants of all kinds of international food along Robson Street. There are at least 5 Starbucks-type coffee places. We ate excellent sushi in a restaurant nearby. City tour busses stop just outside, and walking to downtown is 10-15 minutes at most.Several bicycle rentals are in the same block, so you can get even further away, or take a bike tour along the coast. The rooms are freshly remodelled, beds firm, nice gas fireplaces, flat screen TVs and wireless internet throughout. I stayed in a suite with living room, kitchen. The latter was clean, had sufficient dishware, and all hings you need. Parking garage in the basement is very safe, because the hotels reception desk is located there as well. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Never had any issues. Strongly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As always, I found it a great place to stay. Very comfortable and convenient to work and play downtown.”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaRock
Reviews.Content: I stay here often when in Vancouver on business for more than a few days. It is cost competitive with the downtown business hotels and one gets much more living space, and a full kitchen, staying here. The hotel (really apartment building) is located in the heart of a restaurant packed portion of downtown, so although the hotel lacks a restaurant, it is not a problem. Free high speed internet too. Very comfortable. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: x-well-traveled
Reviews.Content: We have been regular visitors to Vancouver for 20+ years. Most of the time we stay at one of the 2 Westin hotels in the city. They were both booked during our last trip and we stay at the Time Square Suites instead. It is an old apartment building that the owner has turned into a hotel. It is by no means luxury but it is a simple complete fully equipped apartment in an ideal location. There is a roof deck with a barbecue which we used for many dinners, parking was included in the price of the suite, the staff was friendly and very accommodating. We will probably stay there again next time. The thing that desperately needs to be changed is their air conditioning units. Very loud and out of date.

Reviews.Title: “Cool location. Comfy.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret Y
Reviews.Content: Located right in the heart of a great part of Vancouver - plenty of eats, interesting shopping and water front walking - including Stanley Park. Staff helpful on advice to get around the city. Great family accommodation - relaxed and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “It's like having your own apartment, right downtown”
Reviews.Author: CaroleD37
Reviews.Content: Located basically on the corner of Robson St and Denman St, you have everything that you need within walking distance. Restaurants and coffee shops abound and there is a huge grocery store across the street, if you chose to utilize the fully kitchen in your suite. Stanley Park is less than 5 mins walk away, as is the downtown core. If you want to travel further afield, there are many bus routes throughout this area and link up with the Skytrain. If you are happy to walk, you have your choice of waterfronts - either English Bay or Coal Harbour. There are many bicycle rental stores nearby, if you fancy that. The suite was very well equiped and nicely furnished - lots of storage space, a washer & dryer and a very comfy bed. The staff was very friendly and helpful, offering to store luggage and/or vehicles after check-out time, if required. Everything about our stay was fabulous - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “GLIB Tour”
Reviews.Author: BoroniaBoy
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Rooms are very well appointed with the option of cooking in your room or the rooftop bar-b-que. Access to local supermarket, alcohol outlets, banks and restaurants is very easy. The CBD is 6-8 minutes away via the Vancouver bus service and the harbour and Stanley Park only a short walk. The only draw back in our two bedroom suite was the single bathroom but we made it work without to much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay - centrally located and within walking distance to downtown”
Reviews.Author: langleygirl2012
Reviews.Content: We live in the Valley (Langley/Pitt Meadows) and this was our first experience at Times Square Suites. As soon as you open the door, there is a feeling of 'being at home'. This was one of the cleanest places I have been to and we were very impressed. A guest before us had left a beer in the freezer which had leaked and the cleaning staff were right there to take care of it. Very attentive, friendly staff. We used all the transit systems as well as our feet! I'd recommend the Sylvia Hotel for dinner - it's amazing with an incredible view of English Bay, a nice easy walk back. The only thing we didn't do was spend some time on the rooftop deck, which was a shame. There is a great view of Coal Harbour and the city. Next time! I would highly recommend this little nugget in the city. I think this will become an annual event for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent on all aspects!! Why would you stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Veronica H
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed for 6 nights and the entire experience exceeded our expectations. After a long flight, we arrived to a modern, spacious apartment with comfortable beds, 2 flat screen TV's, great kitchen, plenty of towels and lots of storage. We booked a 1 bedroom with Den at a great price for a city location. This place is great value for money. The room was spotlessly clean and is obviously well-maintained. All front desk representatives were friendly and knowledgable and I felt like they really do care about their guests. The location is wonderful - diagnonally across from a huge Safeway which was a bonus for us as we were able to prepare meals and snacks in the great little kitchen; saved us plenty of money! Close to Stanley Park as well as great shopping and there are restaurants everywhere. We found it easy to get around without a car. I would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a great value for it!”
Reviews.Author: Taytol
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend to anyone looking to do some shopping and eating right downtown without having to drive your car everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: RickyBCanada
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week and we found the hotel to be nothing short of 'fantastic'. The staff is responsive and efficient. The rooms are large and well appointed and the location is outstanding. I could not imagine a better place to stay. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “great location/great staff”
Reviews.Author: SEP_11
Reviews.Content: I used other reviews to help choose TSS. As my husband has food allergies, having our own kitchen was a must. The location can't be beat- with a starbucks below for our morning coffee and a grocery store across the street, we here very happy. It was perfect for our family (travelling with a two year old) as we were in walking distance to Stanley Park, the Aquarium and the ferry to Granville Island. The staff were very helpful with all of our questions and gave us some tips on attractions.We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but beware of noise from street”
Reviews.Author: iguana88
Reviews.Content: Reception area and car park was poor. Suite was modern and clean. Got woken up by garbage truck, street cleaner, outside, and from guests returning from inside the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spotlessly clesn, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rabidpenguin101
Reviews.Content: After a great welcome from the helpful and friendly staff, the one bedroom suite on the 1st floor was awesome. It was spotlessly clean, very comfortable and really felt like a home away from home. Other reviews have mentioned it was noisy, but you are right in the heart of the west end of Vancouver and its the best place to stay in Vancouver. It has a little more street noise, but what a location !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarmenPetch
Reviews.Content: We were in Vancouver for the Grey Cup. This hotel was great. Close to all the festivals, great shopping and resturants nearby. Lovely Patio on the roof with a BBQ. Room had a lot of room. Not your normal hotel room. Quiet hotel. Kitchen was great. Bed was soft and if I could have fit it into my luggage I would have. Own washer and dryer was great. Would Stay Here Again in a heartbeat. Also a very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.. Excellent Suite”
Reviews.Author: 34Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Time Square Suties for just one night but would definatley go back. We had the den-studio suite and it was great. Very cute and comfortable will all the comforts of home. The Suite was very clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Good location in downtown and not to far away from anything. We hope to return again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Suite!”
Reviews.Author: RonH133
Reviews.Content: The design, size and decoration of the suite was perfect for a couple. Kitchenette with full size fridge and equipment, even a stacking washer/dryer! Not luxurious but modern, attractive design - lots of space - nice flatscreen TV. Location near Stanley Park, Robson and Denman very good. Friendly service, secure covered parking. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great price. Great service”
Reviews.Author: Kristifarrell
Reviews.Content: I've been returning as a guest for the past years and cannot speak highly enough about Times Square Suites. The location is perfect for shopping or strolling through Stanley Park. The suites can accommodate my stay on business or with my family and the service is always exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Times Square Suites”
Reviews.Author: Aidyn S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in October, the location of TSS is great, just above a Starbucks and Safeway. The room where we were living was 2 bedroom suite, very good room, i would recommend for the family's of four to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Times Square Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy745
Reviews.Content: Subject: Times Square Suites Hotel Location: Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, North America Title: Excellent home from home ID#: 119858132 Lovely room, neat and tidy, receptionists and others behind the scenes make it all so easy to move into and settle. We have used this hotel before because of the nature of the place and its closeness to everything. Close to food shops (over the road), close to cafes, (up and down the street), with a bike hire next door. Walking distance to water front, to the sea planes, even to the wharf and (if keen) to Gastown. And we are no spring chickens! No. 5 bus gets you into the centre of the city where one can catch buses to the BA University and Yaletown. Can even obtain general bus travel to the suspension bridge.

Reviews.Title: “A home in a hotel in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Margriet E
Reviews.Content: I would like to recommend Times Square Suites to anyone who is looking for an apartment hotel with its own kitchen, bedroom and even in suite laundry. The service is excellent. The rooms are clean and fully utilized with appliances, kitchen utensils, cookware, towels, bathtub soap/shampoo/conditioner dispenser. The garage can house many cars. The top floor deck with barbeque equipment enables you to have a nice outdoor get together with friends and family. I immediately felt at home. Grocery stores, such as Safeway and Wholefoods are so close accompanied by the many coffee shops and restaurants. I have already booked my next stay during Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel which for our visit got everything right 10 out of 10. It started with a very friendly and helpful receptionist who despite the late hour 9pm took the time to explain the workings of the hotel , the room and the parking lot arrangements. She took the time to describe the ammenities available including complementary gym/pool (separate site). The apartment itself was superb. It was very well decorated and had excellent facilities including washing powder for the clothes washer/dryer. The bedroom was excellent and very comfortable. Tea , coffee and toiletries where provided with tea/coffee supplies available at modest cost. The location of the hotel is excellent close by Stanley park which is a great pick for the day after travelling to easy jet lag!. Across from the hotel is a great little cafe for breakfast if you dont feel like cooking and there are an abundance of restaurants very close by. (We counted over 10 within a 5 minute walk!. We did fix some evening meals ourselves as there is a Safeway food store right across the street. The hotel is also close to highway 99 which is convienient for the airport and for travelling further afield (We spent a day in Whistler which is an easy drive up the Sea to Sky highway about 2 hours each way). I would have absolutely no hestitation in going back there is the opportunity arose and would recommend it to anyone considering a stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “October 2011”
Reviews.Author: Clay C
Reviews.Content: Outstanding. Stayed in the Den and Studio combination.. very cosy and very reasonable at this time of the year with the special rates..Liked the informal nature of the 'suites'. Very classy introduction with two wine glases set on table and soft music. Plan a repeat stay for when I am not alone.. very comfortable.. great location for downtown events and to stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Beegee91
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Times Square Suites. The location was fabulous - we could walk pretty much everywhere we wanted to go in the city. Being near the park was a bonus, and there were dozens of restaurants within a few blocks. The rooms were comfortable and the kitchen well appointed. I particularly enjoyed the roof deck, where I sat and read while enjoying a great view.

Reviews.Title: “second great stay”
Reviews.Author: Kevin D
Reviews.Content: Our second time staying at the Times Square Suites. 5 minutes to Stanley Park. 3 mInutes to the sea wall. The rooms are clean and spacious, the hide a bed is even comfortable. Nice part of Vancouver in the west end. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone. Very friendly staff both times. Very reasonable price for what you get. The gym is one block away, but has a pool and is very well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay.”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMarilyn
Reviews.Content: Our one night stay at this hotel was beyond our expectations. The suite was roomy and very clean. The kitchen was well stocked with cooking/eating utensils. The furnishings were modern and comfortable. The location of the hotel is very central – easy walking distance to Stanley Park and downtown and lots of restaurants nearby to choose from. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and definitely plan on staying there again. The only thing I would change if possible would be to request a room that is not facing the main road as the traffic was quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chico99
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Times Square Suites and it was as excellent as the first. We have liked the Robson side rooms but our fourth floor room this time had an interesting view out back and was as spotless and well fitted as always. We travel light so having a washer and dryer is greatly appreciated. Although we like Safeway in other places, don't miss Urban Fare and Whole Foods when you want to stock your kitchen here. Quiet location, Starbucks and Stanley Park - what more could we ask? Staff was so helpful and directing us to a quick way to the airport most useful.

Reviews.Title: “This is the way to go”
Reviews.Author: HeathAustralia
Reviews.Content: I love serviced apartments when I am travelling and this was a good one. Clean, great location, all the cooking stuff you need, own washer and dryer. I don't really enjoy travelling for work but an apartment makes it much easier, begins to feel like home. The roof deck is great also. Close to lots of great places to eat and a supermarket across the road. Would definitely stay again. Only negative was the beds were too soft for me, but others might like that.

Reviews.Title: “Times Square Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMSMelb
Reviews.Content: I rented a one-bedroom apartment in this property for the last week in August 2011. Everything about it was perfect. The location is fantastic, with dozens of local restaurants with delicious food at very reasonable prices, many with an Asian flavour. Public transport to other parts of Vancouver was very accessible. The unit itself was the top corner one, so the living space was very large and light. The whole apartment was spotlessly clean, very welcoming upon arrival, very easy to live in and had all the amenities and facilities I could wish, including wi-fi. Being in an apartment made me feel more like a visitor to this friendly city than a tourist. But there was also the advantage of an on-the-spot reception, staffed by very knowledgeable, helpful and friendly people. They repeatedly assisted me with their local knowledge, plus I was able to book a couple of excursions through them which was very convenient. They were also very helpful when I discovered an error in my booking dates on the last day (my own fault) and this was speedily remedied with no fuss. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this accommodation to anyone visiting Vancouver who wants the extra freedom and comfort that an apartment brings over a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: jovan55
Reviews.Content: I did not know what to expect after buying two nights via Groupon but was pleasantly surprised. The suite size was amazing, facing the street, which we loved. There is a Starbucks on the corner below :) THe suite was squeaky clean and so spacious, and the bed, so comfy! We attended the CanWest Show in town and were able to walk to the venue :) Bonus! It was a pleasure to stay at the Times Square Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vancouver BC”
Reviews.Author: mszozobra
Reviews.Content: We found Time Square Suites Hotel to be a great deal in an ideal location for seeing all the things you want to see in Vancouver. So nice having a kitchen and being right accross the street from the Safeway store. We had adjoing rooms with friends and had meals together, it felt like home away from home. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nicole424
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at TSS and would highly recommend to others. We stayed in the studio room and it was perfect for my husband and I. Very neat, clean, and well appointed. We took advantage of the full kitchen and washer and dryer. In the evenings, we enjoyed watching television on the large flatscreen -- and even could have rented movies at the Safeway across the street if we wanted. We enjoyed being close to Stanley Park, and walked everywhere else we wanted to go. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying here. Our suite was quite spacious and fit five of us (3 adults/2 kids) quite well. The suite was very clean and in good condition. Staff was very friendly. The location was great, with so many restaurants nearby, close to tour bus stops (this was our first time in Vancouver, so we used the hop on/hop off bus tour), the water, and a handy Safeway just across the street. This was a very fun way to enjoy our first, but not last visit to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: PrimroseHill219
Reviews.Content: We had the corner unit with the den. It was spacious and light filled. The apartment itself was superbly located, with Safeways merely across the road, Starbucks downstairs and variety of restaurants. The apartment was clean and it lived up to all its promises

Reviews.Title: “Very good for families”
Reviews.Author: djoulieMontreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Times Square suites for 1 week with our 4 months old baby and we really enjoyed our stay. The suite was perfect and they provided a crib for the week. The kitchen was well equiped so it was easy to stay 'home' and make ourselves a meal. Only 2 corners away from Stanley Park and 10 mins by walk from English bay beach, location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: ALawley
Reviews.Content: We stayed after our Disney Cruise and found this to be the perfect place for us! We were a group of 5 families with 11 people total and we were able to find rooms that fit all of our various families comfortable with room to stretch out - which was nice after cruising for a week. The location was perfect and easy walk to Stanley Park and great restaurants. We couldn't resist a night up on the rooftop terrace! We had a great steak dinner, cooked on the BBQ on the terrace and enjoyed a wonderful evening around the roof top tables reliving the fun and adventure of our travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! An apartment with all the amenities!”
Reviews.Author: travel-lionNY
Reviews.Content: Full kitchen and laundry!! And nearby everything!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and perfectly situated”
Reviews.Author: HJG336
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated for tourists (only few steps from Stanley Park and Coal Harbour; surrounded by uncountable restaurants). Completely equipped kitchenette, flat-TV´s in living room and bedroom, complimentary WiFi. Spacious underground parking at moderate fees. Nice roof-top patio with BBQ-equipment. Sparkling feature for smokers: smoking is allowed on roof-top.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! We'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Susan A
Reviews.Content: We were on vacation with our two pre-teens and this turned out to be exactly what we wanted! Lovely location. Steps from Stanley Park. Safeway. Bike rentals. Restaurants of all kinds/budgets. The suite was a 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment with a comfortable sofa bed in the livingroom. The kitchen/dining area was fully loaded. Clean, bright bathroom. There was even a washer/dryer. Fluffy towels and comfortable sheets. The staff were welcoming and helpful. The other guests were friendly! There was also rooftop deck that everyone could use with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and rent bikes to go around Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: lynn s
Reviews.Content: After reading another's review, we decided to stay here so we could have some space in our 2 rooms and for our family of 5 to ride bikes around Stanley Park. Hauling 3 older kids around, we did not want to go "shopping" during our stay in Vancouver, but wanted to actually do an activity together. So half a block a way we rented bikes for 2 hours and took a leisurely but very fun and pleasant bike ride around the park, which was just 2 blocks away. It is about 5.5 miles around. They have a separate bike/rollerblading lane, and then also a walking lane. This apt. hotel was very nice, spacious enough, full kitchen, fluffy and soft bed linens. There is a Starbucks downstairs and a very nice upscale glass Safeway grocery store across the street. USA

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, well situated & with enough privacy to share”
Reviews.Author: Takuan
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel that a couple could share with another person that offered enough privacy to make an arrangement like that possible. I found that at the Times Square Suites which offered a queen bed in a bedroom and a single bed in a small den at opposite sides of the living room/kitchen area. It was perfect and we enjoyed our stay very much. It was clean, quiet (we had a room in the back) large, with comfortable beds dressed in good quality bedding. A nice surprise was a lovely roof top deck. Parking was over 20$ with tax, but we were able to keep our car there after check-out while we toured a bit more which I very much appreciated as the hotel is well situated by Stanley Park and the downtown area. There is no pool or fitness club on site and although you can get a free pass to use one in the neighborhood, it was several blocks away so I didn't use it. All in all, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and I hope to stay there again the next time I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: PaulMagrath
Reviews.Content: Pros: Full size kitchen with everything you need. Large sitting area. Very warm welcome. Lots of information from helpful, friendly staff. Free Wifi internet in every room. Starbucks downstairs. Lots of restaurants nearby. Very close to Stanley Park. Loads of bike rental shops nearby. Hotel provides bike lockup. Access to pool in nearby fitness center included. Rooms spacious, in good repair and very comfortable. TVs in rooms with cable. Friendly staff made aware of local events taking place. Felt at home and welcome throughout our stay. Cons: No central air. Rooms could become a little warm despite the AC. A little expensive. Bed is too soft. Bed is double sized not king.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, well located!”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterwomanUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 teenage children in a two bedroom suite. The accommodation was spacious and clean. The view wasn't great (car park and a side street) but it didn't really matter. We hired bikes from a cycle rental shop just across the road and within 2 minutes we were cycling around Stanley Park! The location could not have been better. We would recommend thie suites as a home away from home in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “top notch in every way. Great accom well located.”
Reviews.Author: thedukesofhazzard17
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite (2 adults and 2 teens) this July. Simply put this is great accommodation, and a real alternative to top ranked hotels. Rooms are well sized, amazingly equipped and very very clean. My only complaint it the air-con was limited to a unit in the window which was noisy. Its location is the best. Opposite a really high quality Safeway’s and on top of a Starbucks. The walk to sunset beach was 5 minutes, passing so very good bars and bistro while Stanley Park was about the same in the opposite direction. A particular pleasure was the rooftop terrace and complimentary BBQ which we were free to use. Oh, and the rooms have their own washer / dryers. I am normally quite a tight reviewer, but this accom deserves the 5 stars they are going to get. A real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and great suites when visiting Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: nylady21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Times Square Suites for a family vacation and loved it. My family of four had one of the large two bedroom apartments. The beds were comfortable, the kitchen was great (although we used it primarily for the refrigerator and ate at all of the wonderful nearby restaurants), and you can't beat the location. The staff was very friendly and helpful, from an early checkin when our train arrived at noon to storing our luggage on our last day. I highly recommend the TSS and plan to be a return visitor on my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem in the heart of vancouver”
Reviews.Author: caitybelle
Reviews.Content: We are so glad to have found this hidden gem. As a family of 4 we need separate sleeping areas for our children and finding a 1 bedroom suite isn't always that easy. The room was large, clean and bright. The full kitchen was wonderful and having laundry in suite was a bonus. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and they even allowed our guest to use the outside lot. There were no additional charges for parking or wi-fi. We would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a home away from home. Sure there is no fancy lobby or bar but this did not matter to us as we were traveling with small children. We will stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and hope to go back!”
Reviews.Author: eemangel
Reviews.Content: Times Square Suites was a perfect hotel/apt. in the heart of Vancouver. It had a full kitchen and was very clean. There was a washer/dryer also which was very convenient to have in the suite. There was a Starbucks and Safeway open until 11 pm just steps away. Very European feel to the place! The bed was extremely comfortable and the sheets were satin smooth. The staff was always there to please the clients. Great place and priced right! Found it on Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff and lovely accomodation”
Reviews.Author: AmGeeFremont
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite at Times Square Suites Hotel at Robson St. We loved the accommodations! The staff was very courteous and helpful. And the location couldn't have been better - it is right next to Stanley park (so we walked to the park most of the days we stayed there), lot of great restaurants on the street, the tour boats also depart from bayshore (walking distance), complementary shuttles to a few places also pickup from Canada Place which is again less than 10 minutes walk. So over all it was a great experience and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in vancouver, bc”
Reviews.Author: tripuser01
Reviews.Content: this is one of the best hotel experience we have in vancouver, bc. great location (end of commercial and beginning of residential neigborhood with walking distance to stanley park). receiption and house care was awesome. one minor suggestion is about the step down into the front door of my room in the 3rd floor. that maybe a tripping hazard. my cousin stayed on the same floor at another room round the corner. when she visited my room she tripped and fell at the entrance without realizing such a step down at my door. they could have made a ramp down to the room door would avoid the fall on her. otherwise everything is super good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: alihigh
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my family has stayed at the Times Square Suites. The first time I stayed in a one bedroom with my baby. This time I returned with my husband and four kids. We were given a suite with two bedrooms and we felt so at home. The staff were such kind people and the room was comfortable, kid friendly and had all we needed to feel at home and receive visitors. I loved that our names were even added to the resident board outside.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: oceanme
Reviews.Content: As always, the Times Square provided perfect accommodations for our family needs this summer. The folks at the Times Square are genuine friendly and helpful. The location is right downtown in the west end and walking distance from many attractions. We really loved the location part. We had a friend from Atlanta that was staying with us and she is planning to come back and stay with the TS again with her husband. I have also referred many other friends that need accommodations in Vancouver to the TS as I know it will be a good place -- home away from home! Thanks Again!

Reviews.Title: “Felt very much at home”
Reviews.Author: WiseOwl49
Reviews.Content: Staff were polite, helpful and coureous. The two bedroom suite was home from home for our 3 day stay and would not hesitate to book at the Times Square Suites again. Well located.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Brisba
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful and the service we received was efficient. We booked through Booking. Com and easily altered our booking via email through the Times Square reception. When we arrived our room was clean and welcoming with piped music through the television. The room was spacious and it was lovely to have a little sitting room, a well stocked kitchen, and laundry facilities. Times Squares is in a great location, with Stanley Park only a short walk away, the Denman Street restaurants just outside the doorway and Safeways across the road. Times Square Suites is a very pleasant place to stay and in a great location. The only thing we were disappointed with was that the apartment didn't have a silent split system air conditioner. After being used to silent air conditioning units we found the air conditioner noisy and it didn't cool the room efficiently. As Times Square is in a busy location it is too noisy to leave the windows open to let the col air in. Nevertheless we would consider staying at Times Square next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sandybuddy
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be beat!!! Two blocks away from Stanley Park and right in the heart of Robson's foodie district. We had a two-bedroom-one-bath place on the fourth floor. The reception staff was very professional and friendly. The place was spotless and stylish. The maid service is good and prompt. All the kitchen appliances and china was very thoughtfully provided and completely clean. Extras such as laundry detergent and shampoo/conditioner/etc were welcome. Noise protection from neighbors was also good. In fact, the only downer of our stay were the hammock-like soft beds. The beds are meant to be normal beds but due to age and a lot of use, they were non-supportive, lumpy, and uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and would not hesitate to recommend”
Reviews.Author: mckaykerri
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a family of five (kids ages 5, 2 and 1), and had such a great time. The location was perfect for us, lots of dining options, with also provided takeaway options so we could eat in our suite. The bus was at our doorstep for easy access to downtown Vancouver, and Stanley park was a five minute walk. There is a Safeway one the opposite corner and an organic whole foods two blocks down on Robson. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment and found it perfect for our needs. The apartment came with everything, including a washer and dryer and full kitchen. We even used the rooftop BBQ one evening for dinner which was lovely. My only (minor) negative were the bedrooms were very light. This would only be an issue for young children and trying to get them to sleep before ten in the summer months. Otherwise I have no hesitations in recommending this accommodation to anyone and would definitely be back - we loved it

Reviews.Title: “We loved and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: michelemurphy
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great staff and awesome location! walking distance to everything!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jokerana
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vancouver in the morning and as it was early our room wasnt ready, but we had no problem storing our luggage safely. The reception was very friendly and offered to call us as soon as it was available. When we were settled the room was very spaciuos for a 1 bedroom apartment, while it wasnt new, it was light, airy and spacious, and had a homely feel rather than the usual sterile hotel feel. Everything about the suites was good, it was located in the central part of town, near all the sights and shops, but was still very quiet and relaxing. the staff were friendly and helpful and all the facilities were clean. It was our first time in Canada and this place was a great introduction to the country

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Positive Experience and Recommended - Recommendation on How to Get Quiet Room”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewer333
Reviews.Content: All the positive reviews for this property are spot on. I spent a week at TSS in late June while attending a conference at the convention center - it's just over a mile away and walkable in 20 minutes. It really is like staying in an apartment - much more apt-like than a hotel room or even a hotel suite. Modern, exceptionally clean and comfortable. I had a car and there's space for maybe 25 or so vehicles in the garage - you pay for it but based on the deal I got on their website ($150) it was worth it. I found the TSS to be very quiet, in terms of hearing other guests. I was on the 3rd floor and rarely heard anything from neighbors above or adjacent. The one and only drawback - and I would direct this especialy to anyone who is sensitive to noise - was my suite faced Denman Street which is a very busy neighborhood street. Vehicle noise is pronounced and very loud even with windows and balcony door shut, particularly on weekends and during rush hour. It did not, however, bother my sleep as there was a nice window A/C unit that drowned it out and I had no problems sleeping. The tip to get a quiet suite would be to either face the alley or Robson - that end of Robson where the TSS faces is residential so those would be quieter than Denman. Overall that was a minor drawback in the scheme of things, but if and when I return I would definitely make the request to not face Denman. It is so nice to be that close to Stanley Park and several bike shops next door to rent a bike to pedal around the park or town in - highly recommended if you have a chance. There's a Starbucks, convenience store, flower shop and several restaurants on the ground floor of the TSS, and Safeway is directly across the street. A block or two walk will take you to all the restaurants and coffee shops you could ever want, and all ethnic cuisines represented. Capers is another market (a small Whole Foods) for organic choices 2 blocks away. You can also catch busses all over town on Denman or Robson, or easily walk to downtown or the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: Jarkko65
Reviews.Content: I put this shortly: This is place to be if you ever visit Vancouver. There is not even tiny detail wrong and location is absolutely the best possible. And as a tiny ad-on you can use their Safeway Club number to get club priced items from Safeway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - exactly as advertised”
Reviews.Author: sbroom
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about the hotel and the staff. Hotel rooms were exactly as advertised. Very clean and fantastic location at a great price! Our flight was late, but the hotel was expecting us and ready for us (at 10:50pm). Staff helped with anything we needed during our stay and no surprises with the bill. Absolutely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: KeepsmilingNC
Reviews.Content: The reviews are true, and I'm so glad we chose to stay at Times Square. The suite was the perfect choice for our week long stay. Everyone was helpful in the office and you can't beat the location. We've never stayed in a place so close to everything. We found ourselves stocking up at the Safeway grocery store each day. We strolled through downtown, and along the waterfront. There was a bike rental store right next door, reasonably priced. What an enjoyable bike ride around Stanley Park. We went in the morning when very few people were out, and it was wonderful. And the restaurants...Ciao Bella, Milestone Grill and the Ukrainian Village exceeded our expectations. All were on Denman Street, close to the hotel. Stay at Times Square. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A super place to stay in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: JudyAF
Reviews.Content: Our suite was wonderful, it felt so luxurious. So much thought had gone into providing everything that we would need. The kitchen was beautiful and there was even powder and tumble dryer sheets provided for the washer/dryer. The bedroom, although above a busy street, was very quiet. The The position of the suites is very good for exploring Vancouver, we were able to walk straight from the suites to both the centre of the city and to explore Stanley Park and the beaches. There's a large supermarket just across the street but there's also many restaurants nearby. An excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - well equipped and very clean”
Reviews.Author: RDandcompany
Reviews.Content: located on hopping Denman street - chock full of great ethnic restaurants.....very close to Stanley Park and English Bay. Full Kitchen - more than we used due to the great restaurants nearby Nice rooftop BBQ area with view of mountains. People are helpful and friendly. Room is very clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: Lagger95
Reviews.Content: If I moved to Vancouver I could happily live in this neighbourhood and Times Square Suites is just the kind of apartment I'd like to have. We had a beautiful two-bedroom suite with a full, well-equipped kitchen plus a washer and dryer. There is a fireplace and flat screen TV. The beds were comfortable and the apartment was very quiet as it was on the back of the building. There was lots of closet space. We appreciated the front door and garage security. Everything we needed was within walking distance and staff were glad to make suggestions for grocery stores and restaurants. I can highly recommend this accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: GmaCAG
Reviews.Content: Times Square Suites is truly a ‘home away from home’ for us. Over the past decade we have had numerous occasions to stay here. In the heart of Vancouver we are only minutes away from English Bay and the Granville Island Ferries and Stanley Park and a walk along the sea wall. Close by the suites are many boutiques and wonderful restaurants. Our primary reason to come to Vancouver is to visit with our wee grandchildren. We had stayed in a North Vancouver location once, but the quality of the suite/rooms was disappointing and we have returned to Times Square. We stayed for a month this time, and by having our own place, we had the opportunity to explore Vancouver, and yet we are only a short trip over the Lion’s Gate Bridge to visit family. The staff at Times Square are friendly and hospitable, but unobtrusive. Housekeeping is scheduled for each suite, but assistance is always available when needed. We love the spacious suite and the amenities, like the in-suite washer and dryer. We had the opportunity to use the roof top patio and barbeque on our last visit, which added to the ‘at home’ feeling. Although on a busy corner, the noise was not extreme. In fact, we shared in the excitement as the Vancouver Canucks beat the Tampa Bay Lightning. We look forward to our next visit to Vancouver as we keep discovering new things to do and new places to visit. Our future trips will definitely include Times Square as our home base. We have recommended this facility to family and to many friends. Calgary, Alberta

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience and we'll definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Syannearoo
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary with a weeklong stay in Vancouver. Times Square Suites were perfect for us! The location was ideal; our suite was clean, comfortable and fully furnished with everything we needed; staff were friendly and efficient; incredible value, all way around; and best of all, a Starbucks in the same building :0) The only thing that would have made our stay perfect was that we didn't get the garage door opener until the day before we were due to leave. The attendant who checked us in forgot to give it to us (even though we paid for parking for the week) and so we had to buzz in every single time we came back - we planned our excursions with the belief we needed to be back by 11:00 p.m. (we thought it was just the way it was). It was only upon inquiry (as we had a late night planned) that we discovered we should have had it all along. Small issue, all things considered.

Reviews.Title: “We love Times Square Suites Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Joe_and_Amanda
Reviews.Content: We were accommodated very well during our stay...everyone was friendly, the rooms were clean, and what other hotels would charge "extra" for was free of charge. The kitchen was used by us several times and was a nice thing to have. The balcony, while small, served as a nice vantage point to watch the revelry after the Canucks won game 2 of the Stanley Cup finals. Vancouver was a great place (utopia for us) and we will be staying at Times Square Suites when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: cslewis112
Reviews.Content: There were no more vacancies at the hotels reserved by the conference I was attending, so went onto Trip Advisor to look at options. SO GLAD I did because I found Times Square Suites!! Much better than any hotel chain!!! Loved the homey feel of the suite. Loved the full kitchen. Didn't get up to the rooftop BBQ unfortunately. Was there during the first few games of the NHL finals - loved the noisy celebrations outside after the games. The noise level subsided later in the evening and didn't interfere with a good night's sleep. Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: zenotravels
Reviews.Content: Frankly we absolutely loved our stay at Times Square Suites in Vancouver. It was what we expected and much more.. We had a one bedroom suite that included a full kitchen (We really did not need the stove but we got a lot of use out of the microwave, fridge, toaster and coffee maker because we did all our breakfasts at the hotel). We also used the washer and dryer - VERY handy for two travellers just off a cross Canada train. They supply a complimentary small box of detergent (enough for one load) and 2 fabric softener sheets. You can purchase additional detergent and fabric softener at the Front Desk (who were most helpful about everything). I LOVED the bed - defintely the most comfortable hotel bed I have slept on. They also supply 2 nice thick bath robes. There was also a nice gas fireplace. Also the staff were just great - very friendly and exceptionally helpful. If you arrive early, they are only too happy to keep your bags secure while you do some sightseeing, The same thing when you leave. (They kept our bags after we checked out until our friends arrived to pick us up.) The location was perfect for us - close to Stanley Park and transit and near lots of restaurants. Only 3 VERY small negatives. It's nice that coffee is supplied but it is really awful Nabob stuff. We tried it once and it was pretty bad - so we just bought our own. Also it would be nice if shampoo was supplied(bath soap is supplied) and the water pressure in the shower was kind of weak. However none of these really impacted our stay in any significant negative way. Who will like this hotel: Travellers who like privacy (staff are quite unintrusive - YOU ask to get your room cleaned) and efficiency (every staff person we encountered was doing their job very well) and cleanliness (the suite was spotless when we arrived). Travellers who like to do some of their own food preparation. Nearly forgot to mention Safeway grocery store is directly diagonally opposite and very well- stocked. Travellers who like having clothes washing facilities Travellers who really appreciate a comfortable bed. Travellers who don't need on-site things like a restaurant or bar (plenty of good restaurants nearby). Travellers who prefer small intimate hotels to large glitzy chains. We will recommend this hotel to friends and really want to stay there again when we next go to Vancouver. We have also sent a copy of this review to Times Square Suites to let them know how pleased we were (a first for me - usually I just review the hotel on-line but I wanted them to know that they were doing everything just right for travellers like us).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaKuMD
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with an unbeatable location. These places used to be condos that have been converted to hotel suites. Huge room with all the amenities you need (washer, dryer, internet, fireplace, full kitchen). Across the street from a Safeway. On top of a Starbucks. Cheapest bike rental is right next door. Safe underground parking for $15 a day. Nice rooftop deck. Will stay here again next time in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for top rate accomodation”
Reviews.Author: missilebob
Reviews.Content: May 2011 = Lorraine and I were looking for an appartment to spend a few days before our cruise to Alaska. Times Square Suites offered an ideal base whilst we explored the city. Hotel staff were very efficient and helpful without intruding into our quiet relaxation. Comfortable beds, clean spacious roome. Our only complaint was the TVs are old analogue with square CRT screens.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the stay and plan to return on our next trip to Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: LForkert
Reviews.Content: We werer impressed by the cleanliness and decor of the unit. Its location is excellent both in terms of proximity to the downtown core but also becasue it is on a quieter part of Robson. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “had a blast, slept like a log!”
Reviews.Author: redhedgurl5
Reviews.Content: great location. seriously. perfect. dining all over the place, starbucks right there on the street, and a safeway kitty corner to the hotel. shopping up the street, stanley park and other attractions just a short hop away, gastown in the other direction. you can easily get anywhere from here. the service was just great, staff was super friendly and the rooms were really comfy, esp the ones in the actual tower part. the beds were so comfy, i'm gonna go get a mattress pad and imitate them!!! all in all, i would most definitely stay here again. there was some street noise, as the canucks made it to the playoffs, but you gotta give some latitude for a celebration of a job well done! i still slept fine with the window cracked, and my portable noise machine that i take everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best Suites In Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: JLynne52
Reviews.Content: I love this place!!! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Times Square! I was only able to enjoy it for one night – but if I come back for any length of time, it will be my choice again! I love being in a neighborhood with restaurants and grocery store nearby – lots within walking distance. And it felt safe. You feel like you are part of the community. Everyone on staff was very nice and made me feel right at home. And the place is incredibly secure so that only those staying there can enter. If you want the feel of having your own apartment while staying in Vancouver – and not just another hotel room – that is what you will get. And the price was unbelievably reasonable, especially for the accommodations you get! In fact, it was $100 LESS than a room at one of the major hotel chains in the area – and with that you only get a room with bath and fridge. Also, the kitchen is stocked with housewares and the whole place is spotless. I was so happy that I happened to find this place!!! The only thing that was an adjustment for me was the traffic noise as my suite faced one of the streets. But I live in a suburb area on an acreage and I am not accustomed to it. And there may be rooms not facing the street. That was just my issue.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely recommend this hotel, the rooms were great and we were near shopping and eateries.”
Reviews.Author: 8888Diane
Reviews.Content: I loved the large two bedroom two bath suites with an ajoining door. They have a living room, great kitchen and dining area, and great bedrooms. I loved the outside access with the small patios. The rooms were very clean and attractive. The customer service was great. It felt like home and I want to return to this "great find".

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MMurphy1
Reviews.Content: Met all expectations. Great staff, clean rooms, close to restaurants and a wonderful location for those of us who love to walk!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Glenn76M
Reviews.Content: Chose this place so we could get to Stanley Park quickly and it's on the doorstep. Good sized suites that are well furnished and confortable, without being "luxurious". The only comment would be the noisey fridge, thats all. The place has fantastic staff, really couldn'd be more helpful and genuine. I would stay here again and as a repeat visitor to Vancity, it is very likely I will.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: Kwjonrie
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at these outstanding apartments which are equipped with all the amenities of a home, nothing lacking in the kitchen as far as pots, pans, dishes and all necessary kitchen appliances are concerned. The apartments are spotless. The location is absolutely ideal with a big Safeway just across the road and many restaurants and small shops in easy walking distance. Stanley Park is only a stone throw away, so is the Coal Harbour waterfront. It is also an easy walk to downtown along that interesting Robson Street. The entire staff of this establishment is extremely friendly and efficient and always ready and willing to be of assistance. We can certainly recommend the Time Square Suites whole heartedly and we will always opt for this accommodation at any time visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value...Excellent Service...Extremely Clean!”
Reviews.Author: sparry7
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised at the value we received when staying at TSS. The staff was extremely accommodating with last minute schedule changes and Rick the night manager was super! The location is perfect with Stanley Park and other amenities (Safeway, restaurants, etc.) within walking distance. We would defeinitely stay again and highly recommend TSS to anyone looking for the most bang for their buck in the west end.

Reviews.Title: “Times Square Suites is a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: TrinaAnneLee
Reviews.Content: Times Square Suites is the best! It is great value, provides excellent service, the rooms are clean, comfortable and cozy and has so many amenities that make you feel right at home. They provide almost everything you could possibly need to have a comfortable stay, short of a toothbrush. We had a lovely barbeque on the rooftop patio and were amazed that paper plates and napkins were all provided. It is truly a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, helpful staff, fantastic location, and great price”
Reviews.Author: jhayles
Reviews.Content: Recently made my first trip to Vancouver on business. I booked Times Square Suites (TSS) for 5-nights due to its proximity to Stanley Park and the waterfront (I'm a runner). Additionally, the property is located a stone's throw from a several grocery stores, numerous restaurants, Starbucks, and bike rental shops.The room was well appointed (my room had a very nice fireplace), spacious, and VERY clean. The staff was very helpful and accommodating regarding shopping, things to do, and how to get around in the city. Overall, my experience at TSS was great and I'll definitely be back on my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location very clean and everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: tannia64
Reviews.Content: The apartment was very clean and had everything you need to feel at home. The bed was very comfortable. It is in a fantastic location, just a short walk from Stanley Park and the Marina. It has a neighborhood guide that has recommendations and maps.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Home away from Home - and I'm fussy!”
Reviews.Author: missbeebirmingham
Reviews.Content: All the positive reviews are exactly right. I chose this hotel purely from the reviews on here - and so glad I did. Location was perfect, easy walking distance from downtown, and Stanley Park. Easy bus access. Loads of great places to eat. Staff were wonderful. Rooms were very comfortable and clean. Security was very good. Felt very safe to leave valuables in the room, and a very safe area. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suite in West End Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: alg308
Reviews.Content: Very nice suite in a central location. We didn't have a car and were able to walk or transit everywhere we wanted to go in Vancouver. The 1-bedroom suite was nice, a little outdated but we didn't have high expectations of a modern contemporary hotel. The sleep quality was the only rating I would have to drop to a 3 - although at the end of Robson where it was quieter night life, the windows seemed very thin and some noise may have been coming in through the air conditioner - I had to bring out the earplugs in order to get a full night's sleep. Otherwise, the housekeeping was as expected and it was good service when we first arrived. Just a note, one of the stove elements didn't work and we didn't find this out until the last night so we were unable to tell management, and also the shower, although nice and hot, did have the pipes start to squeal after about 5 minutes in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Perfect Location, totally enjoyed our visit!!”
Reviews.Author: Avonjerseygirl
Reviews.Content: On our recent visit to Vancouver we stayed at the Times Square Suites! What an awesome find! Lovely suites, SUPER clean, GREAT location to walk to Stanley Park, marina steps sway, tons of local restaurants, coffee shops on the corner, Whole foods 2 blocks, Safeway for shopping.... Highly recommend the Ukranian Restaurant 3 doors down, YUMMY delicious comfort food!! TSS is the Ideal perfect location within Vancouver. We will certainly return for a longer stay in the future! 5-STAR

Reviews.Title: “Location and benefits”
Reviews.Author: Amy_VictoriaBC
Reviews.Content: We've now stayed at Times Square Suites more than 3 times, each time with a 2 year old and a 4 year old. The hotel is perfect for those with young kids.. kitchen (stove, oven, microwave, fridge, dishes, etc..) and a washing machine. We've stayed in room 206 and 214... the latter had a much more comfortable bed (both on the sofa pull out used for the kids and the master). It is the perfect location.. Safeway, Starbucks out your door, lots of great places to eat.. easy walk to Aquarium, parks, beaches.. we will be back! The staff are extra friendly and helpful. There is street noise and lights, but because we keep ourselves busy, we never had a problem going to sleep and staying that way. We always used the gated and secure parking (for a fee).

Reviews.Title: “all hotels should be like this one”
Reviews.Author: jomalvie
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Vancouver was in August, 2004. We loved it and fell in love there. Friends and family wondered "Why Vancouver?" Since the olympics, more people know why. Its clean, diverse, scenic, artsy, friendly, lovely. On the first trip we explored Granville Island, and being foodies, loved the array of produce and meats, but didn't have a way to take advantage of them. This trip, the Times Square Suites, made it feel like "home away from home". There was a real kitchen, of which we took full advantage! Definetly a plus. The roof top deck was nice. If it weren't February, we would have cooked up there too. Our 17 year-old daughter was with us, and it was nice that she had her own space (one bedroom with a den). We watched movies in the living room together and retired to our own rooms for the night. All in all, the apartmen/hotel was clean, secure, cozy, well equiped, and in a good location. The staff was very helpful, but not intrusive. We plan to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Really lucked out”
Reviews.Author: Cynderelli
Reviews.Content: I randomly picked this hotel because of its great reviews, even though it shows to be a 2.5 star hotel. I am SO, SO glad we stayed there! I will never stay anywhere else in Vancouver. There is no bell hop, nor a big fancy lobby, nor room service - which may be why it is rated a 2.5 star. But that is absolute craziness. It should be considered at least a 3.5 star. This place is so nice, so clean and is such a bargain. We had a 1 bedroom suite and it was very cozy, nicely decorated & spacious. I honestly have lived in worse / smaller places. My sister and I were incredibly impressed. The staff was super nice and helpful. The location was ideal, so close to Stanley Park, Robson St, etc. We truly felt like we were at home there. They even put your last name and room # at the front door / intercom system just as if you were a permanent resident. I honestly cannot say enough good things about it! Highly recommend it! It would be especially great for long-term stays.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie_langlois
Reviews.Content: TImes Square Suites really lived up to its expectation. Vast room, very clean, complete kitchen set and just on the edge of Downtown Vancouver. Would go there again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “very nice accommodations at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: FGBFederalWay
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was very well done. Very clean, well decorated and well appointed. Location is excellent, close to Stanley Park, restaurants everywhere, plus a Safeway and Whole Foods market within a block. I thought this was an excellent place to stay if you are looking for comfort and location at a reasonable price. The room isn't extra fancy ( no granite countertops, tile floors or stainless steel appliances) but everything looked new, clean and tasteful. I thought the price was very reasonable. My husband would have liked a bigger TV but not that big a deal to me. We will stay there again next trip. We come to Vancouver often and always stay in the West End.

Reviews.Title: “a terrific place to stay”
Reviews.Author: admitone
Reviews.Content: We rented a wonderful one bedroom apartment, fully equipped for three nights. While not quite central to the business district, it is a lovely location for Stanley Park, restaurants and the ocean. Friendly staff, clean and well appointed, reasonably priced for Vancouver. Recommended for sure.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient location, comfortable, and a good value”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaRock
Reviews.Content: This trip was a mix of business and pleasure, and I usually stay at the Westin Bayshore but ended up at Time Square Suites Hotel because it was the only one with rooms available at the time, but now that I have stayed there, I prefer it to the Westin and will stay at Times Square in the future.
