Yes the TV set is old tech (not flat screen) and the bathroom is not large, but the hotel is clean, very comfortable, and extremely conveniently located for those of us that enjoy walking to and from the offices we visit and restaurants where we eat. The in-room kitchen allowed me to eat a better and much less expensive breakfast than I would otherwise have had, and I appreciated the free wireless internet and free local calls, items that come with an extra cost at the "business class" hotels. My wife, who is very particular about cleanliness, had no issues with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: scottmelon
Reviews.Content: 3rd stop of North American holiday with 3 children under 10. An old apartment residence at one end of Robson St near Stanley Park. 2 adequate bedrooms but very small living area and one cramped bathroom/toilet. Kitchen of reasonable size and washing machine and dryer in room. Ancient TV system. Large supermarket across road and lots of restaurants within easy walking distance. Stanley Park within walking distance however weather in January not conducive to many visits. City centre a fair uphill walk. Not a terrible place to stay apart from the tiny bathroom/toilet, however given the cost and in comparison with previous accommodations in USA this residence under delivered in terms of value for money. Would stay closer to city centre on return visit.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, centrally located and very well equipped.”
Reviews.Author: 3ammar
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, close to all downtown attractions. Very helpful staff. Roomy and well equipped. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a find”
Reviews.Author: winterorfila
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week over Christmas and were really very happy with the experience. We normally stay at the Pan Pacific on our trips to Vancouver but decided to take the plunge and make a change. It was well worth it. We had a one bedroom suite and it was perfect. A good size, clean, well kept and felt very comfortable to spend time in. The location was ideal, very central and with so many amenities on the doorstep. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the secure parking was brilliant. Great to have hotel staff available on the desk all morning and evening made it feel like a hotel. The roof top balcony with BBQ facilities was a lovely touch, we did not use it but visited it in the evening, wonderful views and again nice garden furniture up there! Many thoughtful addages to the suite (we liked the mugs that had TIMES SQ SUITES on them!). Fireplace in the room made it very cosy in the evenings. All in all would definitely recommend this place. Having your own kitchen and laundry facilites made such a difference oh and liked the local resident feel with the recycling bag for our recyclable consumable waste! Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for whatever length of stay...”
Reviews.Author: WLH_Oz
Reviews.Content: Visiting Vancouver for the first time was made even more enjoyable with us staying at Time Square Suites, an affordable fully furnished apartment. Being in Vancouver pre and post-cruise made this hotel the ideal place as starting and finishing points for our daily adventures. It’s conveniently situated opposite a supermarket (Safeway), on top of Starbucks, on a street-full (Denman St) of restaurants, near public transport and is a short stroll from Stanley Park. It’s also an easy 30min walk (depending on your pace) to the CBD, so you’d be getting your daily exercise! Our room pre-cruise was located overlooking Denman St, so we got to hear the local traffic. This didn’t affect our stay at all, in fact it was a great place to do some people watching. Our room post-cruise was located overlooking the back of the apartment, which was nice and peaceful. Regardless of location, both our rooms were clean, neat, and all amenities in tact. Staff were friendly and helpful and if you plan on shopping for groceries at Safeway, be sure to ask for Times Square Suites' member number as this will entitle you to discounted prices on certain grocery items. One thing that could be improved would be a new mattress for the sofa bed. Despite this, Time Square Suites would be a first choice of accommodation I’d recommend to family/friends and also for my revisiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: amuranko
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay. Friendly staff. Ideal location. Will definately be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, amazing...AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: B23Quesnel
Reviews.Content: We came to vancouver for a little week long holiday, and found this gem. The kitchen and laundry facilities we exactually what we were looking for. The rooftop BBQ was a great feature, and even though it was winter we did use it for dinner! The bed, I must say, was the most comfortable bed I have slept on in a very very long time, I had some amazing sleep in this suite!! The staff was very nice and helpful...full of suggestions from everything from resturants to try, to things to see, to things that are new and happening in the city. We had the one bedroom room with balcony and thought it was the perfect size for the two of us. I loved that TSS is soo close to everything, just a short walk to stanley park or the shops on robson or really anywhere for that matter if your up for a nice walk. We would recommend these suites to anyone, they were well worth the small amount you pay, just convience is worth it and this place has all sorts of conviences!! We plan to return in the spring or summer for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent quality, service and terrific location”
Reviews.Author: mamapedia
Reviews.Content: We keep coming back to Times Square Suites over the years. The staff are thorough, welcoming, and completely organized. On our most recent trip we rec'd a high chair brought to our room right away, and they always let us check in early if our room is available, which it was. Parking is convenient. Location is excellent. We have 2 young children, so having a full size kitchen and separate bedroom + living room is key. We love staying here and will continue being regular guests! The free wireless is a huge added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: passionfortravel9
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in a two bedroom suite. The suite was very clean and comfortable. We had one bedroom with a queen sized bed and the other bedroom had twin beds (or they could be made into a king sized bed). We took advantage of the washer/dryer set in our unit to wash my son's clothes (he's a student at UBC). The kitchen had a full stove, a dishwasher a microwave and a full fridge. We bought some groceries nearby and made breakfast in our room. This suite had two smallish TV's but I don't stay in hotel's to watch TV so it wasn't a big deal. For us the best thing about this hotel was the location. At street level (on Denman St) there is a Starbuck's and a very nice little Italian Restaurant. There is a large Safeway store across the street and a nice gourmet/ organic market called Caper's about a block away and a small neighborhood store with fresh produce right beside the front door. The entrance to Stanley Park is a block away and there are bike rental shops across the street. The Beach at English Bay is also a couple of blocks away. There were many, many nice little street side cafes, serving every kind of ethnic and local food imaginable in the blocks around this hotel. When we checked in we buzzed the office from the front door and then we were directed around the back to the parking garage (we had a rental car) were the front desk is located. This building has three floors and many apartments are not part of the hotel (as I understand). It was very quiet in this hotel. It was an additional $12/day for parking in the underground parkade. When we checked in we were told that we could use the gym and pool facilities at a Fitness Center that was a block or two down Denman street for free. I didn't know this ahead of time and I hadn't brought my bathing suit. This hotel had free wi-fi but we didn't have much luck with it when we were trying to use it. It was very intermittent and frustrating to try to use. I don't know if this is how it always is. Eventually we went downstairs to the Starbuck's and used their free wi-fi which was working well. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. We have stayed at the Loden and the Fairmont Pacific Rim previously when we have visited Vancouver. I enjoyed both of those hotels but I think that when we travel as a family it is nice to have more space to spread out and it is great to have separate bedrooms and the ability to have some meals in your room. The Times Square Suites weren't as fancy as those other hotels but they definitely had some advantages in square footage, price, kitchen facilities and location.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jennmtl
Reviews.Content: I just love this hotel. I travel for my work and am constantly on the road. Since I found this hotel a few years ago it is the only place I stay when I am in Vancouver and I always look forward to coming here no matter how busy my schedule is. The place is perfect and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Location, atmosphere, furnishings, facilities - I love everything about it!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: QMTom
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel. The staff that we interacted with were all very helpful and pleasant and we loved the suite. It was like a home away from home. I spend a lot of time in hotels and this was one of the best! The only minus I did notice is that a few of the remotes I tried in the room needed batteries. I swapped out some from one of the units we weren't using. That is a very common thing that I experience in hotels. Otherwise it was excellent! We all especially got a kick out of the little address board at the entrance that had our name on it! Any trip with a stay in Vancouver would certainly involve the Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “In Times Square Suites, we did not feel like tourists - we felt like residents”
Reviews.Author: paotranq
Reviews.Content: My family enjoyed our stay in Vancouver this spring 2010. This is in large part due to Times Square Suites and its staff. The staff were extremely accomodating and helpful. The location is perfect for our needs. The nearby shops were excellent. The room we stayed in was very relaxing. The facilities are well maintained. The place is very comfortable. During our stay in Times Square Suites, we did not feel like tourists - we felt like residents.

Reviews.Title: “Escape to Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: jocat10
Reviews.Content: We came to Vancouver to escape from the prairies for a few days. We had stayed in TSS two nights in May for business, and decided to come back for a mini-vacation. It was fabulous. The 1 bedroom + den 'corner' suite was perfect for our family - a great kitchen, great division of space (the bedroom and den are separated from the living room and kitchen by a long hallway); these are the two most important things for our family. The location is difficult to beat: walking distance (1 block) from Whole Foods Market and across the street from Safeway, tons of interesting shops and restaurants, and a very short drive to main attractions like Stanley park and the Aquarium. The room was clean, the staff was very nice and friendly. I'm not sure what else you could want in a hotel in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “A true home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: corbo7
Reviews.Content: Our family ( husband and 3 year old son) stayed at Time Square Suites in a 1 bedroom suite for 12 nights in October. Our experience was very positive - great clean, well maintained, spacious and well equipped apartments, helpful friendly staff and a handy location (we loved having the Starbucks directly downstairs, Safeway across the street and Stanley Park a short pleasant walk away). We probably could have rented the 1 bedroom and den for a bit of extra space, but found the 1 bedroom adequate for our (and our son's ) needs, given that the lounge area is fairly sizeable. We highly recommend Times Square Suites and would definitely look to stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “very well situated , real "home" feeling, nice service”
Reviews.Author: christianedryland
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a home from home place, well equiped appartments hotel. then this is the place. . Good for a retired couple or a family, plenty of restaurants, Stanley park a two minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely apartment, great location”
Reviews.Author: mazza1London
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a great 3 night stay at Times Square Suites. The apartment was large and comfortable (one bedroom) with everything needed for self-catering and the staff were friendly and helpful but unobtrusive. The location is also great, a really nice area with plenty of restaurants and shops and very close to Stanley Park. I'd definitely recommend staying there, it's a real home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Change for the Business Traveller”
Reviews.Author: Randalljay
Reviews.Content: Rather than stay at the usual downtown pricey hotels for a week, I thought it would be a nice change to stay a little further away in a suite. I also wanted the daily walk to the business centre which was only 20-30 minutes depending on your pace. It's an active neighbourhood so there's lots of restaurants and perhaps a little noisy. But I liked the independence of being able to have breakfast in the room. Room was very big, bed comfortable and you got maid service when you asked for it.

Reviews.Title: “This place is so good, very very good”
Reviews.Author: steviewonder34
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days. Were we lucky to choose this place? You bet we were. It was the end of a long Canadian hoiliday and was purrrrrrfect. Where to start really? Room, well suite was fantasctically equiped, a home from home. Great TV with all the chanels, fridge, freezer, washer, tumble dryer, dishwasher and all the other things. Good quality fittings and large french windows. Good to open them wide in a morning. Bedroom large and bed oh so comfy. Yes really really comfy. Bathroom and strong shower. Staff at reception great and couldn't have been more helpful. Locaton, hard to fault on the edge of Stanley Park, yes it is THE location to be. Safeway supermarket over the road and tons and tons of good value restraunts and bars nearby. My on tip when arriving is , access is ONLY at the rear (once you have booked in they give you a front door key). Room cost about £130 per night. I believe this great value for Vancouver. You will not find better quality and value anywhere in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for viewing the sights & sounds of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Chris_and_Jean
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely-well located apartment block surrounded by decent-enough restaurants; on several bus-routes; and just a couple of blocks from Stanley Park. The gentleman manning the fort when we arrived was Rick and he was happy and able to give us almost all the information we needed to know for our stay; indeed, one of the things that struck us about Vancouver was how friendly & helpful most people seemed to be. Bus links are excellent, with lots running up and down Georgia (Highway 99) to & from the City Centre (#19 to the Waterfront being useful); and the number 5 (which turns into the 6 at the bottom of Denman Street at Beach Ave) providing a 'round the block' service into town. Bus tickets are excellent value and $2.50 will take you almost anywhere. We found it particularly convenient having Safeways supermarket immediately opposite, because one could nip out before breakfast to get fresh rolls etc for lunch (Canadian & US made-up sandwiches not being to our taste!). The accommodation itself was fine and the only real annoyance - which is nothing to do with the management - is the fact that the traffic lights are constantly 'chirping' (alternating in fact between something akin to a 'cuckoo' and more of a croaking sound) to indicate to the dozens of visually impaired people who might wish to cross over the road during the course of a year that it might be safe to do so (but not it seems before 7am weekdays and 9am weekends when they're switched off because these people obviously don't help other than during working hours) . Still, like all noises one does eventually get used to it, and to be fair we were in the closest room (201) and this is unlikely to be such a problem in most of the others. Hope you enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy - but spacious, hospitable, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: DSchret
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in October 2010 and found the accommodations very clean, comfortable, and convenient to restaurants, shopping, and Coal Harbor. The staff were exceedingly helpful and welcoming. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Boutique Hotels we ever...”
Reviews.Author: Guido61
Reviews.Content: One of the best Boutique Hotels we ever have been. Not absolutely in Downtown center but a broad variety of restaurants, bars and shops around the hotel. Spacoous rooms, superb interior design. We'll come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic suites in a great area”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer134
Reviews.Content: We were knocked out by the quality of these suites when we visited recently and could not have found a better home from home for the four nights we stayed in Vancouver. The attention to quality, comfort and security was superb and with the level of equipment including a large fridge freezer, washer dryer, cooker,dishwasher,TV and everything else you could ever need (including a beautiful gas feature fire in the lounge). The suites are close to a large Safeway store for all the essentials, loads of restaurants and of course coffeee shops but is also close to Stanley Park in one direction and the rest of Robson Street and all its shopping in the other. Last but not least a special mention to the staff at reception who were fantastic and were really proud of the Times Square suites.

Reviews.Title: “Still an excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ZandaSpain
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Vancouver and our 3rd stay at Times Square apts/hotel. Standards remain high and we enjoyed our stay very much. Staff are always efficient, pleasant - never intrusive at all. Safeway supermarket was new to us (it was being built when we were last there in 2008) what a great choice of everything! We ate out quite a lot, but Wild Garlic remains a favourite of ours and with the 15% discount offered to TS guests it was not expensive. I have noticed that sometimes comments about the dumpster trucks being noisy have been left on here. We had an apt overlooking the back for our first 3 nights - we never heard a truck - on enquiring we were told they come at 9 a.m and most people are up and about then so it is not a problem. We continued our stay on Robson Street side for a further 10 nights. Where we live in Spain it´s very quiet so it´s a change for us to hear traffic, fire engines and the general noise of a city......................not a problem either. We are world class travellers and can recommend TS to anyone who is thinking of having more space than a hotel room gives you - with TS you actually get a real home to entertain in, chill out and just live a normal life. A nice touch is that TS provide large umberellas. It can rain in Vancouver quite a lot, but in 3 weeks we had only 3 showers. We intend to return again.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem and so much more!”
Reviews.Author: LynsterHfx
Reviews.Content: I happened upon this place from reading reviews on Trip Advisor actually and was not disappointed. We were here for a wedding and decided to stay a few extra days since we were travelling so far (from Nova Scotia). I wanted something that allowed us the feeling of home (living room, kitchen, etc) since anything over a couple nights and it's just what I need. This place is awesome! The staff are great, from my first contact for reservations to our penultimate day were there for us. They arranged cabs and helped us with dinner suggestions and even helped print flight boarding passes. The suites are awesome - very romantic. We opted for the studio with den since it was just us 2 and we were not disappointed. It was great and had everything we needed. Although we never used the fireplace (beginning of Oct) it was so nice to know it was there and how nice it would be in colder weather. The location - perfect. The only downfall for us was the wedding and dinner the night before was by the airport so the cabbing was expensive but our counterparts that stayed close to the airport paid similar to come downtown and to surrounding areas, so it all works out. We were close to more restaurants and markets, coffee shops than anyone would need. We often had a hard time picking what to do as there were so many choices. Cleanliness - the suite was perfectly maintained. We chose to not have any services while there trying to be environmentally conscious. This is one of the only places I've stayed in that actually means it when they say it is an option. If you don't have a "make up room" card out then you don't get your room made up/changed. There are extra towels under bathroom sink if you need them. BONUS - they give you 2 free pouches coffee, tea and enough detergent and softener for laundry initial use. The dishwasher detergent is enough for several washes. The extra fees for more than supplied is more than fair. Overall they think of everything you may need initially. Rates - I think the price is very good for what you get and the location. The only thing I would want differently is a small dresser in the studio units. They have made use of almost every square inch but a wee on that had rollers that fit in the closets would do nicely. For me I used the 'reading room' and its bookcase for that. Loved this place and will definitely come back and refer to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: thestevetravels
Reviews.Content: The Times Square Suites is a great find. The room was clean and met all our needs. The location has easy access to Stanley Park, Coal Harbor, Robson Street, Denman Street, English Bay, and Granville Island. There are a lot of great restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. We actually did not use our car during our stay and mostly walked. The staff was friendly and helpful. When we checked out, they let us continue to park our car in their underground, secure garage while we enjoyed the city for he rest of the day. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “met and exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: jlero
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at Times Square based soley on online reviews, which can sometimes be a risky proposition. "Right Downtown" is usually a euphemism for "bad part of town". However... the location could not have been better! Minutes to everything, including a grocery store, Stanley Park, Robson St shopping, so much more. The room was spacious, well-appointed, very recently renovated, and CLEAN. And the help was... helpful! Definately a GEM. We will return

Reviews.Title: “All the convenience of home”
Reviews.Author: Brits at Home
Reviews.Content: Lovely and clean and everything you would need for a respite from the road - including a washer and dryer! We stayed in a one bedroom with 'balcony', but this is really just a feature to enable you to open the french doors - there is no room to actually sit outside. Bedroom was small with a window air conditioner - the living area and bathroom are not air conditioned, but fans are provided. Underground secure parking if you have a vehicle. Safeway across the road for groceries and within walking distance to restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Super apartment/hotel and would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Rosalie1980
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place to stay in Vancouver. The location, on the corner of Robson and Denman Streets, is less than 10 minutes walk to English Bay, five minutes to Stanley Park and Coal Harbour. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful, with ready smiles, which was was very refreshing! We rented a one-bedroom suite, which was spacious, spotlessly clean, and very nicely decorated. The bedroom had a comfortable queen size bed with a duvet and lovely soft pillows. There was plenty of closet and drawer space, as well as televisions in both the bedroom and living room. Our teenager slept very well on the pull-out sofa bed. The amenities are excellent - there was a washer & dryer tucked away in a closet next to the bathroom, which was very convenient, as well as a full-size fridge, stove and even a dishwasher. There is a roof-top patio, which we used on just one occasion to barbecue our dinner instead of going out. The housekeeping was excellent, and the hotel provides lots of towels, which also makes a pleasant change from a regular hotel. There are dozens of restaurants right on the doorstep - we had no problems deciding where to eat. There are bus stops close by on both Robson and Denman, which will take you downtown, as well as to the ferry to Granville Island, etc. The hotel even gives you a free pass to the nearby fitness centre (including a pool) on Denman St. There was an air conditioner in the bedroom, and all the windows open if you prefer the fresh Vancouver air. We found that it helped to close the windows to deaden noises from the street - this was mainly an issue on the weekend due to some latenight partyers in the street behind the building. Request a room at the back of the hotel if traffic sounds bother you - the staff managed to accommodate this request. The underground parking was secure and very reasonably priced. I really can't say enough about our positive experience at this hotel. I used to live in Vancouver, on the next street over, so I know the area very well, and I can honestly say that if you want to get a real "Vancouver experience" - i.e., access to fantastic Stanley Park, bike rentals, beautiful beaches, sunsets at English Bay (with coffee in hand from one of the numerous coffee shops on Denman), then this is the area to stay in. It is very safe, and despite the many nearby tourist attractions, it is actually a high-density residential area, with a real community feel. Given the rates of the surrounding hotels, Times Square Suites is very good value - I highly recommend it, and would love to stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “30th Anniversary Celebration”
Reviews.Author: TrojanMom
Reviews.Content: We chose Vancouver to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary with our adult children and could not have asked for a better place to stay than the Times Square Suites Hotel. The two-bedroom suite was perfect for our family and so centrally located to Stanley Park and the other fabulous attractions in Vancouver. We took full advantage of the super-Safeway across the street and made regular visits to the Starbucks that was a stone's throw from the hotel. Special mention is needed for Mark and his fabulous staff who helped us with all our questions. We are planning our next trip to Vancouver and will most definetly stay at Times Square Suites again!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hidden gem in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: starfishinsf
Reviews.Content: We are so impressed by the friendliness, cleanliness and efficiency of this small establishment. Everything is so well thought out ~ cups and plates for BBQ on rooftop patio.. umbrellas in the elevator lobby on each floor. The location is extremely convenient , surrounded by numerous good restaurants; supermarket; liquor stores.. near Stanley Park and the picturesque English Bay.. We only deducted a point for sleep quality because our room faced the backstreet where the garbage trucks can be quite noisy in the mornings ..but for early risers..it won't be a problem at all! We will definitely return as it certainly feels like our home away from home...=)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic suite, great location and superb staff!”
Reviews.Author: Namcan
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my fiance and my mother and we stayed in a two bedroom suite on the second floor. The space couldn't have been more perfect for the three of us. Both my fiance and I have lots of family in Vancouver and it was lovely to be able to host an informal engagement visit in our living room. Had there been more of us, we could have easily moved up to the comfortable rooftop patio, which has a nice BBQ and a cupboard full of paper plates, cutlery and placemats. The location was great, the room was superb and most notably the staff was friendly, courteous and very helpful. We will definitely stay at the Times Square Suites again and we will be sure to recommend these accoms to our friends and family. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: way2much
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in mid August and it was the best hotel we have ever stayed at. The suite was extremely clean, well furnished and felt more like a home away from home vs. a hotel. Extremely comfortable bed and bedding. Service was incredible, with a cot provided as promised and front desk booking a ferry trip for us with no hassle. Location is ideal with Stanley Park, English Bay, and tons of restaurants nearby. Wireless internet worked great. No pool or fitness center, but they provide free access to a nearby fitness center. The only negative was that with a fully equipped kitchen and a beautiful Safeway kitty corner, we felt guilty eating at one of the many great restaurants we could see from our balcony. Can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could find this hotel in every city”
Reviews.Author: Amy_from_NYC
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel I wish I could find whenever traveling with my family. Arrived at 10:00 in the morning off the Alaska cruise. Room was ready and they let us use it even though 6 hours before check in. Bike rental around corner, great location for Vancouver sightseeing and restaurants. Large suite with kitchen - Safeway across street. Great to unwinde with our two teen age sons after a week on a cruise ship. Staff is friendly - gave me the $5 internet for free. Roof top deck has lovely views and a bbq. Would be happy to stay here a week. Would work well for business also.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mike5717
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Times Square Suites in Aug 2010. Our suite was a perfect location for our visit to Vancouver. 15 min walk to the aquarium, 20 min walk to the ferry to Granvile Island and right where all the good stuff is on Denman Street. It was really nice to have lots of space in our room to relax between outings. The staff is excellent and very accomodating and informative! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “A good apartment hotel, handy for food shopping, public transport and Stanley Park.”
Reviews.Author: Brendajane
Reviews.Content: The apartment was very clean when we arrived and was well equipped for cooking. We had a one bed apartment with a den for our teenage daughter, the den was small but adequate for her. Safeway is just across the street so it was very easy to get all the food shopping we needed. The location of the apartment is very handy for public transport and within easy walking distance of English Bay and Stanley Park. There are numerous restaurants of all types in the nearby streets. The only thing we did not like about our apartment was the lack of natural light in the living area. There were windows in our bedroon and the den. We knew about the window situation when we did the booking so the hotel did not misrepresent anything, we just did not fully appreciate how this would be in reality. The internet connection was fast and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Calgary_Traveller00
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at the Times Square Suites. Great location, nice suites, at a very competitive rate. The suite itself was outstanding. We were traveling with my parents and we had a 2 bedroom. It was very clean with comfortable beds, modern, and well-equipped. It would have been nice to have a second bathroom but we made out ok with just one. We loved the location. Easy walking distance to the beautiful waterfront and Stanley Park. It was nice to take a short walk to one of the many restaurants in the area, Starbucks, or across the street to Safeway. One night we bought some groceries and had a barbeque on the roof-top patio. We had to wait a while for the barbeque because another family had just started it up when we got there but we weren’t in a big hurry so that was ok (perhaps a second grill would be a nice-to-have). They even provide aluminum foil and other barbeque supplies. It was very pleasant up there on the patio. I will definitely stay at the Times Square Suites next time I'm in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home--great for families”
Reviews.Author: phoebesnow
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We were in the two connecting one-bedroom suites, and that was plenty of room for the five of us (three adults and two children). We were impressed at the quality of the crib and highchair for our youngest. The rooms were clean, the bed linens were very soft, and the towels were plentiful. It was a bit warm in one of the bedrooms, but the AC did help. The roof top deck is a real gem. We enjoyed grilling and dining up there and enjoying the view. When we return to Vancouver , we will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: phoebevught
Reviews.Content: Great Location, close to the Stanley Park and in Robson Street. Starbucks next door and the Whole Foods is a 3 minutes walk. This is a wonderful organic supermarket where you can buy everything for your breakfast or the picknick/lunch on the go. The suites have their own little kitchen. Kids sleep on the pull out sofa. It is a little bit noisy because you're on Robson Street but not too bad. The suites do not have a very special interior, a little bit old fashioned, but it's clean and fresh. There is a parking lot at the back of the suites, very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great option travelilng with kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: jizaurieta
Reviews.Content: We stayed (with my wife and kids ages 7, 5 and 2) for 7 nights and it was great. The location is amazing, with Stanley Park and bicycle rental just a few steps away. The crew is nice, great securty and ammenities. The room was very clean and the layout was great. There is a Starbucks right underneath the hotel and a Safeway across the street. Overal it was a great option and we would defenately stay here again. The only drawbacks were that the A/C and fans were not enough to cool down the room and it was a bit noisy because it faced the service area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: Snori672
Reviews.Content: If you're travelling with children, THIS is the place to stay. Why go to bed when your children do? Tuck them in, enjoy a glass of wine in the living room, watch a DVD, surf the Net, do laundry, pack a picnic for Stanley Park...it couldn't be a better place to stay.The location is fantastic (2min to Stanley Park, across the street to get groceries, 30 seconds to Starbucks!), the suites are lovely, the staff is helpful and gracious. Above all, it's a tremendous value! Without a doubt, we won't stay anywhere else in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Hot & Noisy”
Reviews.Author: DZ2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was hot - fans worked OK with the windows open but noise from dumpsters behind building were so bad that the room even came with ear plugs. The windows had no screens but we didn't have any issues with bugs on 4th floor. The small window a/c for bedroom did not cool anything but that room. The other bedroom had no closet and a glass doorway. It was basically a den that a double bed could barely fit into. The small carpet was also smelly in that room and we placed it into kitchen's closet. It was a cheap carpet where the glue begins to fail. The tub was slick and younger child slipped while showering. Parking garage has only 6' 4" clearance. People at check in and out were very polite and helpful as well as all other guest we meet.

Reviews.Title: “Maids could have done a better job.”
Reviews.Author: Mikeman222
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the olympics... There was 5 people in our group per room.. And one day the maids did a terrible job making the beds. Everything was half asked. Never tip the maids when they do a half asked job..

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: x-opal-x
Reviews.Content: This hotel is squeaky clean and in a pefect location. We loved it! It was quiet but had everything we needed to have a great holiday within 100yds. The staff were friendly and helpful. Don't go anywhere else in Vancouver!!

Reviews.Title: “Out of the four hotels stayed in during our tour of Canada, the Times Square Suites were by far the superior.”
Reviews.Author: Dyski
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and very helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. The room was an unexpected upgrade and spotless. A comfortable bed, spacious accommodation and very clean with every amenity needed to ensure a most pleasant stay. The hotel was on the corner of 2 very busy streets, Denman and Robson, and within easy walking distance of Stanley Park and English Bay. The Vanouver Trolley service was easily accessible from the hotel and worth buying a ticket to explore this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Sue_n_Peter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June, initially in a one bedroom with den apartment and then moved to one of the larger two bedroom apartments when the rest of our family arrived. Both apartments were on the 4th floor and faced towards Stanley Park. Noise was not an issue - except when the large refuse bins were emptied - and the beds were some of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. and our daughter, who drew the short straw and ended up on the bed-settee said even it was comfortable. Both apartments were extremely well-equipped and we could not have asked for a more helpful staff . It is in an area known as "the West End" which is a largely residential area and very safe. There are many varied restaurants and all of the ones we visited were prepared to to do meals for take-out and there is a liquor store almost opposite the apartments so it's easy to have a special meal in the apartment whenever you want. We travelled by Sky Train from the airport and opted to walk from there to the apartments, which is a 25-30 minute walk, although we could easily have taken a local bus to West Georgia at Denman. The move from one apartment to the other was quite painless for us - our suitcases and the fridge contents were transferred for us by the staff after we left the apartments for the day. We wanted to visit Granville Island and buy some fresh oysters so one member of staff - Jackie - made sure we found a store which sold an oyster shucking knife so we could open them ourselves - by far the cheapest way to enjoy them. If ever we return to Vancouver, this will be our first port of call, though I hope our British pound will fare better against the Canadian dollar when we do!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: wew89
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was located in Vancouver's West End on Robson & Denman. There was a Safeway grocery store across the street, Starbucks right below the hotel, and hundreds of restaurants nearby. The owner of the hotel even recommended a couple of restaurants within walking distance and gave us directions. I am a light sleeper, and thankfully the street was quiet at night and both the bed and pullout couch were comfortable. It was also convenient to have a full kitchen and stacked washer/dryer in the room. There was also a nice view and a grill available on the rooftop deck. I highly recommend Times Square Suites and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Taste Of City Living In Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Two-For-Texas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Times Square Suites Hotel for four nights. We selected it based upon Trip Advisor postings and its location close to Stanley Park and public transportation. The location meant we would not require a rental car. We took the SkyTrain from the airport to downtown and then boarded the trolley to take us to Georgia Street and Denman, just a short block and a half walk to the Hotel. It is European pension style with a small entry way and elevator. The staff is in a small office downstairs. We were given a warm welcome and a map was marked up for us for the things we wanted to see and do. Our room had all the facilities to support our stay including a small washer and dryer, cook top, small dining area, sitting and TV area and bedroom. Double doors opened onto the really teeny ledge with railings, but it was enough to check out the street action below. We could look down Robson Street into the condo district and tree lined streets leading to Stanley Park about two blocks away. Coal Harbor was a short walk. There was a Starbucks right downstairs with an outdoor patio. Across the street was Safeway with a place on the upper deck to drink coffee. A restaurant for breakfast stood on the other corner. And, dozens of restaurants and shops within a few blocks. We were taken by finding our name on the resident list posted at the entry. Home away from Home. We could get a good view of the city from the roof top patio also. We did not take advantage of the barbeque grill on this trip. This place was a great base for our public transit trips (bus, trolley, ferry, water taxi) all over Vancouver, North Vancouver, Granville Island, Gas Town, Chinatown, Library and for our walks into Stanley Park. For our style of travel, the location was just perfect and the hotel served us very well. When we left, we caught an electric bus to within a short walk of Canada Place where we boarded our cruise ship. Such a joy to live in a city for four days with no car to park. We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: liz_inpdx
Reviews.Content: This was just a perfect location for an anniversary trip! It was private for being on busy Robson street. Tucked right on the end near Stanley park, it was still quiet but in the heart of all that goes on. We loved that there was a huge Safeway kitty corner for small trips. Have I mentioned the rooftop patio/garden? What a great place to go relax with a bottle of wine and look over the city. The suite had every ammenity we could ask for (possibly more dishes than we have at home!!). The staff were great and parking was directly under the building. Super great neighborhood with awesome restaurants right near by. We wouldn't stay anywhere else. I was originally nervous as our local pals hadn't heard of Times Square Suites, but now they have and will recommend this to their friends. Thank you, guys. We will make it a point to visit Vancouver again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: Shuntros
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in Vancouver at Times Square Suites. An extremely pleasant stay and would recommend to anyone. Beautiful suites, great location with all amenities nearby, rooftop patio with great views and BBQ, free wifi, helpful and accommodating staff, kitchen very well kitted out. This would be my first choice if I visit Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing home away from home in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: rnangel425
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place! I stayed for a week with my husband and 16 month old daughter. It was wonderful! They had a crib for us in the small den (a perfect second bedroom but cheaper than the 2 bedroom suite), and even a high chair. Having a washer and dryer, and a full kitchen was a lifesaver. The location can't be beat, starbucks right downstairs, safeway across the street, and whole foods a block away. Stanley park is a short walk, english bay beach, robson shopping. The staff is friendly and helpful, the price was a great value! Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: AlisonLoughton
Reviews.Content: What a great place, ticked all the boxes for us! These suites are in downtown Vancouver. We flew into VYR and got the sky train to City Centre. This took 20 mins and cost $7.25 (its was only $3.50 on the way back!) The suites were about a 20 min walk along Robson Street. On our arrival the man on reception was very polite and our check in was very efficient. We booked a small suite (208) We were pleasantly surprised by the size. Alll the fans were on and classical music was playing, a nice touch! The bed is not huge though. The suite was spotless and even had a washer/dryer with soap provided. The best bit about this location is that fact that it is 2 mins walk from Stanley Park, the best place to spend a day in Vancouver. We hired bikes for $15 for 5 hours. There are countless hire places available, you will need to leave ID while you have the bike. The park has a great cycling and running track around the outside. We ran around it at about 6am (10k per lap) you just can't beat the views. Across the road from the suites is a huge Safeways and there is a Starbucks underneath. If you like Sushi this is the place to be, hundreds of restaurants and take aways, all cheap and very nice. Our suite overlooked the back and we heard no street noise at all. I thought the area was clean and safe and at no time, even when out on my own felt vulnerable. Would highly recommend this place. Thanks Times Square for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, fantasic accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: morv_g
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May after having read the reviews on here. We were not disappointed. We arrived early evening, and were told we had been upgraded. This was great, although with there being only 2 of us we never actually used the second bedroom, but nice to have the space. The kitchen was well stocked, and it was so handy having the laundry facilities within the suite. You are provided with a small packet (one wash) of laundry detergent and bounce, which gets you started and you can purchase more from the office which saves you buying a full box (we were flying so it would have been wasted). the suite was spacious and well laid out. We had a great sleep on a comfortable bed. The kitchen and bathroom were very clean, as was the rest of the suite. Our room faced onto the street, but we were not bothered by traffic noise at all. There are numerous restaurants and cafes within a block or two of the hotel if you want something nearby. Handy for Stanley Park, and also Robson Street. We parked in the basement and the overnight charge was reasonable for having the in and out priveleges and convenience of having the car nearby. Security is good, as you need your key to access the street level doors as well as the elevator. All in all a great stay. Staff were very helfpul and friendly. Even letting my husband borrow a blackberry charger from the lost and found as he had forgotten his. nothing was too much trouble. We'd stay here again next time we are in Vancouver and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this accommodation to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place !”
Reviews.Author: SBrasil
Reviews.Content: I really recomend staying in Times Square Suites. It was, for us, nice place, very clean and beautifull suite! We have nothing that disapointed us. Even the noise of the semaphore pedestrian sounded like a bird to us ...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Blankko
Reviews.Content: What a great place. Our apartment was modern, spacious, very comfortable in all respects, tastefully furnished and decorated, and had a large, well equipped kitchen. In addition, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the location was ideal - close to the marina, Stanley Park and plenty of excellent restaurants. In summary, a perfect base for our four day visit to Vancouver of which the highlight was probably the firework display that formed part of an annual competition between Canada, China and the UK. We also enjoyed the challenge of the Grouse Grind in North Vancouver and the spectacular views from the top.

Reviews.Title: “What a luxurious stay!!”
Reviews.Author: sylvieNC
Reviews.Content: What a great place. It was near Stanley Park and downtown Vancouver. We could do our laundry, eat meals and walk down the street to Stanley Park for a hike. It was like being at home!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Find!”
Reviews.Author: Chico99
Reviews.Content: Having recently stayed in San Franciso, Portland and Seattle, Times Square Suites in Vancouver offers great value in comparison. The location is perfect: the quiet end of Robson Street, a few minutes from Stanley Park. The rooms we had were more than spacious (the room the previous reviewer chose was clearly too small and not intended for 4 people) and there are several sizes to choose from. My room faced Robson St. and I was never bothered by noise. Imagine - a gas fireplace, balcony, separate bedroom, 2 plasma tvs, living room, kitchen, washer and dryer for $137 (including tax) a night. I LOVED it and look forward to returning very soon!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: BakerBristol
Reviews.Content: We found Times Square suites comfortable,attractive and well maintained. The location was convenient and within easy walk to most attractions. The staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jfors
Reviews.Content: The apartments are excellently located in downtown Vancouver. You are just one block from Stanley Park and in the heart of everything. The apartment we stayed in was spacious (two bedrooms, living room and kitchen) and absolutely clean. You have a supermarket just outside the door so that you can buy everything you require for the meals that you wish to prepare by yourself. Do not miss the terrace on the roof with the large barbecue. This is a really nice place to relax in the evening. We would definitely stay here again when we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Book now. Fantastic place.”
Reviews.Author: Hellcats
Reviews.Content: Firstly this is a serviced apartment which sounds posh but travelling with a child it is the best way to go. You have your own apartment with a front door and kitchen and space to move around, fantastic. Also welcomed was the washer/dryer. Plenty of places nearby to get take out to eat in your own kitchen. The apartment was spotlessly clean, and were cleaned 3 times during our 9 days stay. Roof patio with views of mountains is a fabulous place to have a barbecue with free use of their barbecue and disposable plates and cutlery. Location is perfect on Robson St with its shops and restaurants but far enough away from the centre of the city, 5 mins to Stanley park. Did not notice any excessive traffic noise that someone else was troubled by. Staff are so helpful if you need them but unobtrusive. Next time I am in Vancouver then will definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Like having your own apartment in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: SarahGibson
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and 9 year-old son had a standard 2 bedroomed suite for 7 nights for our first trip to Vancouver. Generally we were very pleased that we chose to stay here - the beds were comfortable with good pillows and linens, there were plenty of towels and also bathrobes which I personally appreciate when travelling. There were 2 TVs in the suite plus DVD and CD players. The kitchen was excellent, with full-size oven, microwave, kettle (important for us tea-swilling Brits!) plus full laundry facilities. The suite was spotlessly clean, and we had the rooms serviced twice during our week's stay. (I think we could have asked for it more often if we'd wanted). Our suite was at the back of the building and we were not bothered by street noise. Reception staff were always friendly and helpful. The only minor niggle was the air conditioning - it was really hot weather during our stay and there was only an actual air conditioning unit in the main bedroom which was noisy, and fans in the living area and second bedroom. And, if I'm being really honest, I would have preferred a large 2 bedroomed suite had one been free, as opposed to a standard, just because the bedrooms were quite compact. However, back to the good points - the location was great! We like the relaxed atmosphere of the neighbourhood and felt really at home and safe. Definitely a good area to stay for families. The building itself is quite secure, as you need your key to use the lift. There were any number of shops right on the doorstep, including Safeways where we bought drinks, lovely fruit and breakfast supplies, and Capers market which has everything for a gorgeous picnic. Loads of restaurants too - we loved Nook (in the same building as the suites) and Mondo Gelato for dessert. English Bay and the waterfront are all within a few minutes' walk, and it's only a little further to catch the ferry to Granville Island, but the best thing is being so near to Stanley Park, where there are so many things to do and just a great place to spend time. If I am ever lucky enough to return to Vancouver I would certainly choose to stay at Times Square Suites again, and there is no better recommendation than that.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkfriedo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in early August with our 2 young childrend (3 and 7). The 2 bedroom suite was perfect for us. Well supplied kitchen made simple meal preparation a real cost saver. The location was excellent - able to walk to a multitude of restaurants, grocery stores, shopping and Stanley Park. Rooftop barbecue was a nice touch - even though we didn't use it. Access to indoor pool and fitness center 4 blocks away worked well for us. Underground/secure parking was reasonably priced. Staff were very helpful. Would definitely return for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “second visit - much quieter room the first time”
Reviews.Author: gracefulreader
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel when working in Vancouver a few years ago. I had such a great experience that I chose it again when stopping in Vancouver headed to a ski trip in Sun Peaks. I still think this is a great location. But the room we were in was two floors above the busy intersection and I had to wear earplugs (I always travel with them). Still very clean, the staff is super friendly. The park is very close, there is a great new grocery store across the street. The local organic market Capers on Robsen is now owned by Whole Foods. We tried the famous Japo Dog and many terrific coffees. Mostly just walked around and explored the city with a nice day trip to West Vancouver and Granville Island. I would stay there again, but maybe request a room facing the back of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Having an enjoyable visit at Timessquare suites living like Vancouverites.”
Reviews.Author: surgeon67
Reviews.Content: We had almost two weeks at Timessquare suites with our 1,5 years old son in July of 2009.We did all our shopping from Safeway near the suites.I also advice Capers Organic food market and Public market in Granville island.Washer&dryer in every suites is very useful and necessary with families travelling with toddlers like us.We were scheduled two times a week housekeeping service.This is good for you.Because all t the linens and towels are changed; your room is cleaned in each service.The area of the suites is very convenient to reach to all attractions in Vancouver.If you want to have coffee,there is a branch of Starbuck's.I also recommend you to see English bay,Stanley Park and walking from Stanley to new Exhibition center through the see shore.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: JessePerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Times Square before and after a cruise from Vancouver. We went on positive comments from Tripadvisor but not knowing the area we were concerned we would be a bit isolated from everything because it is not right in the city, but we were very happy with the position - couldn't be better. It was handy to transport, restaurants, shops, a Safeway store across the road, Stanley Park, everything nearby and the neighbourhood was safe. Our 2-bed suite faced Robson Street on the 2nd floor. It was perfect for us. It was spotless and contained everything we needed. The complex was very secure and quiet. The unit itself was a great design and had absolutely everything in it. It was home from home and an absolute delight to be in. The fittings and appliances were near new. We would recommend Times Sqare Suites to anyone . The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Times Square is hot, dirty and NOISY !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: topseyturvey1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2009.I wont stay here again.I dont ever feel the urge to write a review but my experience was so bad I felt I should warn others.The Location is close to Stanley Park but its on the corner of Robson and Denman which is a Major road and bottle neck 8 hrs of the day.The noise is unbearable.Im talking HONK HONK Rumble rumble all friggin day and night until 2 am.The airconditioning is pitiful so when you close the windows to shut out the noise you boil !! It has several restuarants under it and the smell of fish grilling is very strong.I found the hygiene of the rooms very substandard.There was blood on the wall by the bed and the bathroom stank of pee around the toilet. I dont know why the other reviews are so rewarding for this building .Maybe its the hotel staff writing them. After 4 days I couldn't stand it and got a refund minus the 4 days (after arguing the fact that Im not sattisfied for 2 hrs).I took a suite with my wife at the Lord Stanley which was just around the corner.Ironically their is also a review on trip advisor about this hotel giving it a thumbs down by someone who left to stay in the Times Square !Hmmmmmm. The Lord Stanley was perfect for us.Not a five star but easily a 3 or 4 .

Reviews.Title: “Wish You were here.”
Reviews.Author: Henden34
Reviews.Content: We recently had to make a short visit to Vancouver from England and was searching the net when, among others, Times Square popped up. Looking at reviews of other short term suites this property had some pretty good reports. So booked online and was very plesantly surprised with the confirmation emails I received. When we arrived at the 'back lane' garage entrance, I was slightly unsure of what the apartment would be like. The small office maybe situated in the parking garage however, the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Security does not seem to be a problem as you even need a key to use the elevator!. So up to the apartment, we only needed their 'Studio'. The apartment was very clean and well equipped. They even supply starter packs for the washing machine and dishwasher. The furnishings seemed quite new and the bed made us feel we did not want to get up in the mornings! Whenever we get a chance to get back to Vancouver, we will definitely be using Times Square again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Alberta_Running_Girl
Reviews.Content: The room had a fully equipped kitchenette, a very comfortable beds and great shower. It is tastefully decorated and has great light. The front desk person was knowledgeable and my room was impeccably clean during my two night stay. The hotel is located above an excellent restaurant where I had lovely appetisers and wine on my first evening there. It is in walking distance of the ocean and many clothes stores. And finally it is across the street from Safeway which made eating some meals in my room very convenient. I plan to stay there again next time I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Times Square Suites Hotel is a true home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: HalfMarathoner78
Reviews.Content: A comfortable, relaxing get away spot, perfect for either a short business trip or an extended holiday stay. Times Square Suites Hotel has impeccable service and superb cleanliness-what you would expect in any hotel. You really feel like you are taken care of! The room was spacious and arranged nicely with a lovely kitchen and plush, luxurious bedding. Located on Robson Street, it is the perfect place to get all of your needs met with shopping and restaurants and it is a 10 minute walk to beautiful Stanley Park. Next time I am in Vancouver I will definitely be staying at Times Square Suites Hotel! Thank you for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,excellent set up,very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: DONANDMAY
Reviews.Content: Three generations of our family have used this accommodation several times.The suites are beautifully fitted out,and very well maintained. The situation is perfect for Stanley Park, the Coal Harbour waterfront,and ten minutes walk from English Bay, twenty minutes walk from the City Centre.Excellent eateries are very close, with coffee shops and food stores on the doorstep. Staff could not be more helpful. This is a great place for your base in this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “a home away from home on stanley park's doorstep”
Reviews.Author: roeboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a terrific stay at the Times Square suites for 5 nights in June while visiting beautiful Vancouver at the beginning of our west coast adventure taking in B.C. and Alaska. I t suited us perfectly. Having laterally stayed at a more downtown location at the end our trip, I can say without hesitation that the location of the Times Square Suites is far superior. It is located on the corner of Robson and Denman in Vancouver's trendy west end and is literally a 5 minute walk to both coal harbour and the magnificent Stanley Park. In my opinion, if you are visiting Vancouver, it is the perfect location... just far enought away from the tourist hotspots to help you feel as if you are living like a local but close enough should you need/want to explore the attractions the city has to offer. The hotel itself... and I use that term loosely was terrific. Our 1 bedroom suite was spacious, spotlessly clean and indeed a little better than we had even imagined. The air conditioning was excellent and the fully functioning kitchen made life easier. The reason I hesitate to call this place a hotel is that it truely feels more like having your own little city centre flat than being governed by the rules and restrictions often associated with hotel stays. The staff were as accomodating as you needed them to be but all in all just left you to get on with enjoying your stay. In addition, you have a lovely cafe downstairs, a complementary membership to a superb gym located a few blocks away and are on the doorstep to numerous ethnic eateries and as I said before... Stanley Park and its attractions. The best complement I can pay this place is that whenever we return to Vancouver this is where we will be staying... no question.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs.......................”
Reviews.Author: ZandaSpain
Reviews.Content: Visiting Canada for 5 weeks I decided to book apts. more than hotels so that we had a temporary home rather than a room. This filled the bill perfectly! We stepped through the door of apt 403 and belonged! This was our home for 11 nights. The apt was very tastefully furnished, clean and so well equipped with everything you needed. Beds were so comfortable and linen and towels of good quality. We got 2 cleans a week and if you needed anything you only had to ask and it was done. The staff in reception were courteous, efficient and very friendly. We could contact them at anytime, but they were never intrusive. It was hard to believe that 42 apts were occupied in the building because we hardly ever saw anyone else, and there was NO noise in the building at all. The surrounding neighbourhood is safe and easy to get around. We walked most places, and took taxis which were cheap. Stanley Park is a beautiful area to spend leisure time. There is a supermarket called Food for Less just down Denman Street behind Shoppers Mart Pharmacy - I never saw food so cheap anywhere in Canada and the quality was excellent. We didn´t self cater but for those who wish to I would advise them to stock up here. We bought lots of fruit, milk, juice and basics. There is a small shop near the entrance in Robson St, but it´s almost double the price for everything. The X Spot cafe on the corner of Denman/Robson make very good sandwiches. Bo Jangles is good too. The Wild Garlic Bistro near the junction is excellent. and such friendly and efficient staff. If you want to go book as it´s only a small place that gets full regularly..................you won´t be disappointed! We intend going to back in 2009 and will stay at Times Square suites. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: missyscotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in a studio+den located at the rear of the premises and we were never bothered by any noise. The apartment was immaculate as were the corridors and entrance. The kitchen was well equipped in every way. The outside temperature while we were there was around 70, so the temperature inside the apartment was fine, but I will say if higher temperature, I could see that it might get overheated as air con was not very powerfull and was too noisy to run at night. The location is excellent a few minutes from Stanley park about ten minutes walk over to English Bay and restaurants of every kind close by, as are two supermarkets. The staff were all very friendly and very helpful. On the occasions I had enquiries all of the staff I spoke to (three different members of staff) at reception,were extremely helpful and nothing was too much bother. All in all we had an excellent stay in this apartment suite.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Vicki10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Times Square Suites on Robson Street in Vancouver for four nights in August. We had originally booked a two bedroom suite but, as our travel companions were arriving a day ahead of us, we were given two one bedroom apartments with an adjoining door. The apartments were roomy, nicely decorated and very comfortable...... nice bathroom and washing machine/dryer in a hidden closet in the living area. The kitchen was well appointed although we didn't feel the need to cook with so many eateries close by. The small balcony we had overlooked Robson Street and our only complaint was that there was a wedding in the restaurant below one evening that seemed to spill out into the street ....... the noise made it a bit diffiuclt to sleep. The Times Square is close to the corner of Robson and Denman so it's within walking distance of lots of great places to eat (Denman Street) and shopping along Robson Street. It's proximity to Stanley Park was also a plus ... lots to explore right on your doorstep. The Times Square staff were friendly and attentive ....... always helpful (we left our bags in storage with them for four days and they didn't charge us !) We highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for somewhere to stay in Vancouver and we will certainly stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: chick1616
Reviews.Content: I booked Times Square Suites because of its rave reviews even though it cost more than I really wanted to spend and it was worth the extra. Accommodation is great with everything you could need including dishwasher, personal rather than communal washer and dryer and an extremely well equipped kitchen. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the location was perfect. There are many cafes and restaurants nearby and its right on the edge of Stanley Park which is a lovely place where we spent a lot of time - particularly good for an early morning stroll with jet lag! The organic supermarket a couple of blocks away sells lovely chlled pre-prepared food which is perfect if you fancy an evening in. This was a great start to our Canada holiday and probably the nicest place we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Kate+Peter
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff here were very friendly and helpful with both the accomodation and local Vancouver info. The location was excellent with a couple of coffee shops close by for breakfast and a plethora of excellent restaurants for dinner. The accomodation was excellent, immaculately clean and someone has obviously spent a great deal of time thinking of all the little things that make your stay a little easier like dishwasher tablets a washer dryer and best of all a really comfortable sofa. Whilst there was no air-con in the living are we found that opening the windows created a good through draft and the air-con in the bedroom was very welcome. The roof terrace on the 4th floor was a great place for breakfast and relaxing with coffee and the gas BBQ with all the supplies was a bonus. Having stayed in numerous similar style properties all over Canada and the US I have to say this is one of the best we've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! But...”
Reviews.Author: Happythree
Reviews.Content: After a 12 days visit from Kelowna and Rockies, we like to try some towndown hotel but homefeel style suite is most preferable. The times square suites just fit our need! We stayed in a 2 bedrooms suite, it was super tidy, clean and comfortable. The kitchen is fully equipped. The most I loved is the in-room washing faciilities....as we've piles of clothes to wash. The location is so convenience. Choice of world's cusine just downstairs. 5 minutes drive to Stanley Park...... However, there's one issue quite disappointed me:( I requested the staff to give us a quiet suite since my early booking in Apr, 08 and once again made my request for a quiet suite two weeks ahead of our arrival. I was so concern as I learnt from reviews that to avoid suites near the junction of Devon and Robson St. However, they reply that our suite is 'okay' for us and have no complaint so far. But, the 3 nights we're suffering from the noise by the busy traffic till late mid-night and came again early at 7am. The most annoying thing was the noise from the fire-engines and ambulances which came not a few! Moreover, there're no air-conditioning in the small bedroom and the living room. We need to open windows , so the noise ...you can imagine. Overall, we recommend the times square suites to you, but beware of the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, made a great trip into a fantastic one!”
Reviews.Author: Laoldar
Reviews.Content: On the advice of Trip Advisor, I booked 5 nights in a Studio/Den room. The building was beautiful, the room was incredibly clean and the staff was friendly. It is in a great part of town, with stores and restaurants for any taste. A very short walk away from a main bus line and right by Stanley Park. Having a fully functional kitchen was convenient and helped save costs on food. Having a DVD player on the TV also helped with entertainment after a long day seeing the sights. The room isn't made up every night and there's no room service, but once you're here you realize who unimportant those useless frills are. Someone comes in to change the towels every few days and you're set. Very quiet in the room as well, with the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! I couldn't recommend this place highly enough. It's easily the best hotel I've ever stayed at and the price is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Space”
Reviews.Author: drjeff
Reviews.Content: My wife and son and I stayed here on the advice of Trip Advisor. We had a roomy spotless 2 bedroom suite. We really enjoyed the large space and the location. The hotel was very close to Stanley Park and was in an area full of variou ethnic restaurants. We used the health club of another hotel 4 blocks away. We found the hotel staff couteous and helpful. We did not like to have to pay for the room in advance. It was also warm when we were there and the suite had only 1 window air conditioner in the master bedroom so it was necessary to leave the bedroom door open to keep the suite cool. This would be a better choice in the cooler months. Otherwise for the price it was a good deal since most hotel rooms cost more than this suite in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: smkstl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Times Square Suites with my wife and kids (15 and 13) for three nights, June 29 - July 2. It was the perfect place to wrap up a two-week trip across Western Canada. The suite was well-equipped; we especially appreciated the en suite washer and dryer and dishwasher. The separate corner nook with twin bed was perfect for our daughter and the bed in the master bedroom was very comfortable. Bathroom fixtures and appointments were fine as well. A few minor downsides - no wireless internet, had to pay for an ethernet connection. Also, cooling is limited to a window unit in the master bedroom; the kids did not complain about being too hot, though. TV in the common room was dated, but the flat panel in the master bedroom was great. Some reviews have complained about bad service from staff - ours was excellent. The location of Times Square Suites is absolutely perfect - right at the corner of Robson (shopping) and Denman (eating). Five minute walk to Stanley Park or Coal Harbour, ten minutes to English Bay. We would spend a week here any time - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, apartment style accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ScipioAfricanus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location with many, many restaurants and pubs located within a few blocks walking distance. The area is very "local" in flavor and certainly not touristy. The restaurants are excellent with lots of different cuisines from every corner of the world. The hotel itself is probably a convereted apartment building above street level shops. The rooms were very clean and well kept. The staff was simply excellent and far more friendly and helpful than most hotels. The only downside was that there was no central air conditioning. There was a window unit in the master bedroom, and a rotating floor unit that you could place someplace else, but we found it hot and uncomfortable at times. Otherwise, a great stay with super staff in a fantastic area of town.

Reviews.Title: “good for the park but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Rlucraft
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice within a week (we spent the weekend in Victoria in the middle) so had the chance to sample 2 suites. Both were clean and confortable, the main issue being the noise, which was relentless from both the traffic and building site across the road - so if you are a light sleeper ask for a suite at the back. We also stayed during the hotest day on record, and despite very noisy air-conditioning it was still pretty hot in the suite. on the plus side, the hotel is very near Stanley Park, which is great for an early morning walk when trying to get over jet-lag. It is also a short walk to the harbour and the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to start our trip”
Reviews.Author: Elbo71
Reviews.Content: After a long flight with a 3 year old we were more than happy with our suite. Clean, spacious and very comfortable, perfect for relaxing and felt very homely. Bathroom (very important to me!) was clean and modern and the staff were very friendly, welcoming and offered tourist advice willingly. Location is great, near Stanley Park, lots of restaurants and cafes and shopping areas. Away from the really touristy bits. Overall, highly recommended, I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place tro stay”
Reviews.Author: Frommy
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on the corner of Robson and Denman Sts. Very nice, small, dining establishments in easy reach, and only a short walk to Stanley Park in one direction, and shopping on Robson in the other. Apartment was very well appointed, and very clean. Staff were very helpful in regard to our infrequent requests. We were travelling with our 30+ daughter, and even she appreciated the little nook that she had for her bedroom separate from the living area, while we also had the privacy of our own bedroom. Thank you Times Square Suites for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Juandah
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Times Square Suites, which we found easy to locate and clean, if a little dated. It was great to have our own washing facilities built in. We had a studio den at the back of the building which meant it was much quieter than the rooms overlooking the street. The location is very convenient for dining and shopping and walks through Stanley Park. Maintenance could be improved at Times Square Suites - on our last night the shower/bath tap seized and could not be moved. Another annoyance was that we had made arrangements for an early checkout on our last day, and were advised that the office was open from 7am. Staff were very late to arrive, which made us late departing for our next destination. This place targets the business market, yet we were disappointed to find high charges for internet access and connection problems. Despite the convenience of the location and facilities, having compared with our friends who stayed in other accommodations in Vancouver, we think we could have done so much better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travellinman88
Reviews.Content: My wife, 9 month old baby and myself stayed at the suites in April 2008. We were very excited to stay at the suites based on the wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor but were soon sorry that we booked here. Not only did we receive a rude booking email stating that there is to be no noise after 11:00pm we were informed that all payments must be made in advance before viewing the room without a chance of any money back. All of this should have set off alarm bells but we were so excited to visit Vancouver that we overlooked these HUGE warning signs. Upon arrival, with a tired baby we were rudely greeted in a dank parking garage/office by a equally rude gal named Diane. She seemed very uninterested in our comfort and had quick uninformative information regarding our tourism inquiries. Once arriving in the "suite" we discovered the crib we had regested was missing in action. There is no local to call the desk so we had to make the trek back to the parking garage area to have the crib delivered. The delivery took over an hour which seemed like forever with a tired baby. When my wife turned down the blanket she found it crusted with the vomit of another occupant. Another trip to the garage was required. Once this crib situation was sorted we settled in for a noisy night in what seemed to be a suite adjoining a honeymooning couple. It appears that we were booked into one of the adjoining suites which constitutes a thin, gaping door that adjoins our bedroom and another suites livingroom. The noises were very loud and colourful and lasted late into the night.
