Not only was the fridge still full of the previous tenants contents, the counter was burned, the carpet stained and the bathroom full of hair and mildew, the bedding was yellowed and the furnishings tacky and mismatched. In the morning we headed back to the garage to inquire about checking out early as this "bordelo" type hotel was clearly not the family establishment we had invisioned. We were abruptly and terlsy informed that there were to be no refunds on our 5 night booking and that we were stuck in the "bordello suite" for the rest of our stay. We decided to forgo any extras during our stay in Vancouver and left this disgrace of a hotel as soon as we could pack our bags. We suggest you save yourself the trouble and book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “None better”
Reviews.Author: jimmybeam23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at these suites for two weeks and we could not fault any of the staff at that time. The one bedroom suite that we were in was emaculate. When we made any enquiries as to trips in or around Vancouver the on duty staff certainly went out of their way to find out times and prices for us. I would heartily recommend this accomodation to anyone wanting to go to vancouver for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel when travelling with children.”
Reviews.Author: travellingfamily88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay when travelling with children (we have a 4 year old & an 18 month old). We stayed for 3 nights & chose to face the back alley so we would have a quiet room (some rooms face Robson Street). Even though we faced the alley, we still had a partial view of a marina & the mountains. The suites are like apartment condos & come complete with a full kitchen, washer, dryer and seperate bedrooms (which is nice, so everyone doesn't have to go to bed when your youngest goes to sleep, like in a typical hotel room). We were provided with a high chair & a crib on wheels at no charge. We put the baby in our bedroom until we went to sleep, then rolled the crib into the living room for the night. The rooms are nicely decorated. The hotel is clean & quiet. There is a tiny market next to the hotel. It is very pricey. We found a great organic grocery store a short walk down Robson Street. We cooked some of our own meals, which is easier than going out for every meal when travelling with kids. There is also a Bistro and a pizza place next to the hotel. Diana was very helpful & upgraded us to a two bedroom suite. All the staff were pleasent & we did not encounter any of the rudeness which had been detailed in other reviews. The hotel is in a good location. Walk along Robson St. for shopping, Denman St. for restaurants. Close to Stanley Park (Aquarium, beaches, playground, horse & carriage rides, totem poles & miniature trains). The Lion's Gate bridge is also a close drive for access to the Capilano Suspension Bridge (expensive) & Grouse Mountain. Also a close drive to downtown (Gastown, Chinatown, Granville Island etc). Our Chevy Avalanche fit nicely in the secure underground parkade. The only minor downfalls were: They charge $12/day for parking in the parkade, the tap on the bathroom sink came off, the kitchen counter had a burn and a ding in it and one of the lamps by the bed didn't work. Overall, this is a great hotel & we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, this time better.”
Reviews.Author: puilam
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in late March. The last time we were here was Xmas 2004 and the place has improved. Improvements include new living room furniture, upgraded bed linens, and inclusion of robes. The only downside was the internet connection which is not wireless (yet, we hope). Although there is high-speed connection it was very slow at times. Most reviews include the merits of Times Square: great location, closeness to Stanley Park, many restaurant choices nearby, good shopping... This is an ideal spot for families. The staff were courteous and very helpful. Staying here makes us feel like Vancouverites, not just tourists. Give this place a try if you like to make your own breakfasts and have all the conveniences of a self-contained apartment. Don't go here if you want first class Ritz service.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a local”
Reviews.Author: FairyNuffManchester
Reviews.Content: It's great to have all the benefits of a hotel; the maid service, clean towels, concierge without the restrictions. We were able to use the roof top terrace to entertain our Vancouver friends, shop at the Robson Street Market like locals and at the same time get to know people just a little in a way that if we were cocooned in a hotel wouldn't have been possible. Vancouver is such an accessible city, both literally as it's small and walking is safe and because people talk to you, no really they do! The suites are located just outside Stanley Park, it's a stroll to the marina and a stroll to down town - perfect. The best thing though? One of the best restaurants in the city The Tapastree is almost directly beneath you. Not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: lucysdad
Reviews.Content: I live in Vancouver and I have often recommended Times Square to friends and family visiting Vancouver and decided to finally try it out for myself. We were celebrating my partner's birthday. We had dinner reservations in the area so I had booked a suite for ourselves as a treat. Checking in was a breeze. Staff were friendly and efficient. The suite itself was more than I expected. Everything was great. Nice furniture, comfortable bed, good quality linens. My only regret is that I couldn't stay for a couple more days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service could've been a little bit better”
Reviews.Author: singaporeboy
Reviews.Content: My family (wife + 2 small children) stayed here for five days in January. We really enjoyed our stay here, for the following reasons: 1) Great location. We love Japanese food and it was great having fantastic Japanese food at our doorstep (across the street). Besides Japanese, there were great Korean, Asian and other restaurants in every direction. Cafe Bojangles downstairs had very, very good coffee too. We ate in every night for dinner and were spoilt for choice. 2) The room was spacious, large enough for the kids and their toys to sprawl out. Lots of storage space, and we also appreciated having a washing machine and dryer in the room (rather than in a separate laundry room). The housekeeping staff were good and kept the room in excellent condition. Bedding was very good -- not Four Seasons quality, but certainly much better than a lot of generic hotels I've stayed at. 3) Kitchen was well equipped, and we liked having a large fridge and a convenient microwave. 4) I appreciate the free access to Denman Fitness down the street. Lots of machines, and a nice pool too. (Note: it's five minute walk away). 5) The hotel is about a 10 - 15 minute walk to the heart of Robson Street shopping. So it's not too far, and not too near too. And it's a nice walk. Here are the downsides: 1) They didn't have wifi! So I had to sit next to the phone jack with my laptop. This was surprising since wifi is almost ubiquitous, even in small hotel and motel chains. 2) Noise! There was some construction in the building when we were there -- I think one of the shops in the building were being renovated. The construction went on till the evening, and one night, past 11 pm! I called the hotel manager to make a complaint, and he said that "they know better than to go on so late". The next evening the noise stopped earlier. 3) The staff - as has been noted - were a little bit terse. They didn't go out of their way to help, but they weren't unfriendly or unhelpful either. So I would be neutral about them. The office was very, very small - my wife and kids had to stand outside with our luggage while I filled in the forms. It should be redone to make it more welcoming and inviting. All told, we liked Time Square Suites, and we would certainly come back again if we could.

Reviews.Title: “so rude so i cancelled”
Reviews.Author: welltravelled77
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews of this hotel on trip advisor i booked a stay, the email correspondence ive received after this has been nothing short of terse and they never actually answer the questions you ask them without arrogance and an almost condescending tone! ive cancelled the booking!

Reviews.Title: “Such rude service”
Reviews.Author: dreamonixx
Reviews.Content: We are a group of six travelling to Vancouver. I contacted this property and booked out two, one-bedroom suites which made up enough room for us. In our party we have 3 Senior Business people, a Doctor,an actor and a flight attendant. I received these EXACT words back with the confirmaton : "Please note too that we are a small boutique hotel and cater to mostly businessmen, judges, doctors etc and are therefore very quiet. We do not permit our guests to make noise after 11pm". I could not believe that they assumed we would be making noise after 11pm. Neither could I belive they assumed that we were NOT professionals. Additionally, what proof do they have that businessmen, judges and doctors are not noisy people? We were so shocked by their predictive discrimination that the booking was cancelled immediately. I am unable to understand how this business has been rated #1 with such low levels of customer development.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Pinkpolly
Reviews.Content: Great value stay in Times Square Suites. The suite is nice - nothing fancy but very functional for spending time in a city. The staff where excellent and very helpful. No compliants. Very convenient as well for seeing Vancouver. Would definintely stay again if I am ever in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for short or long stays”
Reviews.Author: Review_Monkeys
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay for a week or longer. Far better value than a hotel for our week in Vancouver - and much more spatious, complete with kitchen!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Bozzy31
Reviews.Content: Again I stayed at Times Square Suites when I traveled to Vancouver this past week. They always seem to have great service and make you feel right at home. This stay was better than the last. I stayed in a very cozy room with my own washer and dryer, dishwasher, kitchen, air conditioner, fireplace, balcony, fridge, microwave, queen size bed, a living room and bed room with television. Nothing better than falling asleep while watching your favourite late night tv show on a 27'' Samsung LCD TV. Across the street they are doing alot of development to the local grocery store(Safeway and small office building). Only a few blocks East is Stanley Park (as beautiful as ever) and to the West the beach, this hotel's location is perfect. Robson street shopping is a good as ever and with many great restaurant's are only a few blocks away you have alot of decisions for dining. Also with your stay at Times Square you get a free entry to the Denman Fitness Center. They have a gym, pool, hot tub and sauna. I highly recommend Times Square for your next Vancouver trip.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better! Perfect with baby!”
Reviews.Author: pdxcathy
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier. We had our one-year-old with us and they had every amenity we could need from crib and bedding to high chair to washer and dryer. The room was fantastic (we stayed in a one-bedroom) and the location couldn't be better. Beyond that, the staff was wonderful and answered all our questions and helped us with everything from ferry schedules to places to eat. Even though it's "apartments" you get the service of a hotel in that way. This is the first time i've written a review because it was so great. I just wish it was a little less expensive so we could have stayed longer, but you get what you pay for in this case.

Reviews.Title: “The best for self catering holidays and longer stays”
Reviews.Author: Ayup
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in 3 "long term", kitchennette, self catering apartment hotels in Vancouver Downtown and without a shadow of a doubt Times Square is the best. I stayed in Sandman Suites and Sunset Inn, both near Davie and Burrard as well as Times Square, each for a night to get the general feel of the place. Times Square beat the other two hands down. (Sandman, too much of a hotel feel, Sunset, a bit of a dive). I have stayed in two further rooms at Times Square over the month long stay (while looking for a house to rent) so feel qualified to give my opinion. Most hotels in Canada offer a monthly rate if you stay over 30 days as they don't have to pay the tax. This can drop the price considerably (to around 50% of the normal rate) if you are staying that long. Times Square offers a very homely feel and the rooms are better designed. The furniture is what you would expect in your house, not a hotel, the kitchen is well equipped with a dishwasher (free powder) and a washing machine and drier (buy your own powder) tucked away in the cupboard in the Canadian style. The kitchen also has lots of the little things that you need at "home" like sharp knives, colander, potato peeler, that kind of thing, all clean and working perfectly. Someone has obviously put a lot of thought into what you might need. Cleanliness: Always clean, everywhere. On shorter stays cleaning is daily I think, on longer stays (month) it is twice a week but to be honest there have only been a couple of days in the month where it wasn't cleaned so I think they come in pretty much everyday. All the common areas are clean and the housekeeping staff friendly. Security: Key only access from the street into a small foyer with same key used to call the lift for double protection. Key access to your room with a deadbolt and strong viewing chain - not that you'll need either. Location: Robson and Denman is a not glitzy, it's more residential - it is at the start of main residential area near Stanley Park. You can feel comfortable walking late at night on your own. There is a small shop below (give the guy a break, he has just bought it and is really working hard at making sure that it is a success, stop by and tell him what you want to see in the shop!) there are plenty of sandwhich shops and coffee shops within a block and turnonto Georgia and you can see Coal Harbour and Stanley Park, two of the most attractive areas of Vancouver. Traffic Noise: The rooms on Denman which are close to the junction have lots of traffic noise especially in the twilight hours - can disturb sleep - these are rooms 211-214 (and respective floors above (311, etc). I stayed 1 night on the Robson side (on a previous visit) and that was OK. I also stayed a week at the rear of the hotel which was near silent! Finding the hotel when you arrive: This is difficult but it is better to park round the back where there are spaces, then when you have your parking access you can just drive the car in. Alleyway West of Denman, North of Robson behind the Times Square hotel. Times Square written on white garage door. Soundproofing: Some noise can be heard from people walking about upstairs and some non-intrusive toilet flushing but otherwise that is it, nothing from either side. No conversational noise, no hallway noise, very quiet indeed. Dishwasher is fairly noisy but I never heard my neighbours'. Travelling with an infant?: The "den" is ideal for a cot, the hotel will remove the small bed in there if you want. Not sure a fully grown adult would want to stay in the den as a bedroom, a bit small. Internet Access: Is available on a pay per day with around a $40 cap for longer stays so good value. Fast and reliable hard wired to a standard ethernet socket using a cable which is available from the desk (or use your own). Parking: Again is a cost but cheaper than anywhere else. Secure underground parkade with remote entry and access straight up to the hotel. In 30 days at full occupancy in the hotel apparently, I always found a space. Bathroom and Shower: Clean and tidy with plenty of power to the shower! Things they could do better: I had a couple of terribly minor points with one staff member not knowing what the other was doing with my reservation but you can get that anywhere and it wasn't really an inconvenience. It's also a bit warm in the rooms but nothing a flick of the airconditioner or opening a window can't fix. That's about it to be honest. Overall: It strikes me that someone has really thought about the hotel "home from home" experience and applied it here.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: matsurfer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks in vancouver. Stayed at the times square suites for 1st three nights. My wife booked it and i was dubious about it as i hadnt heard much about it. All i can say is that the apartment we had was huge, really clean, private, peaceful ect,,,everything you want in accomodation. Best bit was arriving from the uk at 10 pm and seeing our room, with realaxing music playing from the stereo system and the fire going, just the ideal thing after a long flight. We paid only 450 bucks for 3 nights,, to stay at the shaeraton for a similar size suite wouldve been over 1000, and this is way better. The guys at reception were really good, they spent about 20 mins caloing the greyhound and ferry companys on our behalf and couldnt do enough to help. We tried booking our last 3 nights there also, but was fully booked. All i can say is ive stayed in hundreds of hotels and this was the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: RankinAuckland
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 2 children) stayed at the Times Square for 4 nights. The hotel staff were pleasant and very friendly. The room was very clean, and the kitchen well stocked with cooking utensils etc. The washing machine and dryer were an extra bonus, especially since we were going to be touring Canada for 2 weeks. The only negative is that the main sitting room area of our room was a little dark, and also very stuffy. The only windows in the room were in the master bedroom, and the den, which ment there was very little air flow throughout the room. There was an air conditioning unit in the bedroom, and a fan in the living area, so that did help. All over, a very nice place to say, and the location very good. It was lovely to be so close to lots of great restaurants, the harbour, and Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: SGF123
Reviews.Content: we returned from Vancouver yesterday having spent 11 nights at Times Square Suites and I felt I had to write to commend them as highly as possible!! The location is great - Robson/Denman so near to restaurants, cafes, Stanley Park, Shops, Sky Train etc. We had a room with a den which we used as room for our 14 month old son - as soon as the maids realised this they moved the single bed that was already there to make room for the travel cot originally left in the master room. We had a problem with a squeaky door to the den (would not have bothered but were concerned about waking our son each time we checked on him) and this was fixed within an hour. The DVD didn't work so was replaced immediately. The facilities were excellent - they call it a "home from home" and it was just that!! We will definitely stay at TSS if in Vancouver again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ShoppingBound12
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay so much that I am highly recommending this place to all...unless you are looking for the typical hotel experience. The suite we stayed in was clean, clean, clean and the kitchen had absolutely everything you would need. Our bed was comfortable and the size of the rooms were good enough for the two of us. There was a DVD, two TV's, stereo system, a fan and central air. The bathroom provided us with plenty of towels - more than we needed. The only problem we encountered was not the hotels fault, but the construction around us. It was a little noisy, however, this wasn't a big deal. The staff was very helpful, booking tours and explaining the bus system and how to get around. Stanley Park is two blocks away and if you turn the other way you are in the heart of the shopping district. Listen, I wanted to move in here. Note- the Tapastree restaurant just downstairs (not a part of the hotel) was fantastic! A must stop. The food was fresh and the service was grand!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley WONDERFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bunji_7
Reviews.Content: This was a great place in a great location. It was roomy, clean, and I felt part of the neighborhood rather than some tourist looking around. The people were pleasant and helpful. If you are looking for a hotel with a restaurant, room service and a bar - then this is not for you. However, there were plenty of restaurants close by - it was more like a "home away from home" which I prefer. If you need a great place to stay at a reasonable price, consider this property. If I am ever in Vancouver again, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel84
Reviews.Content: Once you find this little gem of a place (it is only a door, but clearly marked) and open the door to your suite, you'll be delighted. My hubby's remark was: Honey, you really out did yourself at this one! (Some research and TripAdvisor helped!) Ours was a one-bedroom and the bed was luxurious. The kitchen, though we didn't use it, was nicely stocked with utensils. What we liked so much was how tastefully it was decorated. Wish we could have taken home the pictures on the walls! We had a suite facing the alley--not a good view, but quiet, with lots of windows/doors to let light in. The underground, gated parking was well worth the $12/day. In a city as large as Vancouver and with so many one-way streets and so much construction, using the bus was wise. We used Big Bus and could hop off and on. Times Square Suites was an exellent choice for us and we'll definitely return whenever we're in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spot”
Reviews.Author: IrelandKilkennycat
Reviews.Content: Was amazed with lovely dining room/kitchen along with the bedroom. Plenty of space and very good kitchen facilities and great to have use of a washing machine while travelling. Had no car, but no need as many attractions were within walking distance. We bought a hop on hop off bus pass for two days so brought us to everywhere we needed to see. Even though Safeway across the street was closed , there was a lovely store two blocks away with beautiful food if you wanted to eat in. Even though room was on the street there was no noise and with door of bedroom open temperature could be controlled. All in all a great find would definitely stay if in Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Suites in Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: MLH75
Reviews.Content: My family (husband and 2 children 1 and 3 years) stayed at the Times Square Suites in August for 2 nights. They were fantastic. We were upgraded from a 1 bedroom to a 1 bedroom with den suit. I will get the criticism over first: - Shower was a standard average hotel shower and the bathroom was quite small -The bedrooms were rather small, but then we were not there to spend all our time in the bedroom. -The Safeway that is supposed to be across the road has actually closed down- the nearest supermarket is a few blocks away. I would have liked to have known that before I got there, so I could pick up supplies on the drive in. On the positive side ( and there were many positives): - the location is great. We walked to Stanley Park and the Aquarium- only about 15 minutes for my 3 year old to walk. The Robson St bus leaves from just over the road, and takes all of 10 minutes if that to get into the shopping district. There are plenty of great places to eat within walking distance. - The staff are really friendly and knowledgable about the area. Diana was particularily helpful. - The suite was clean!!! I wasn't worried about eating off the plates without washing them first. - The living areas are spacious and comfortable, and the kitchen was really well equipped. We used the suites high chair which was great. I would definitely use the Times Square Suites again, and recommend them for families travelling with small children.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: demonpanda
Reviews.Content: We had booked the large 2 BR suite for 4 adults. Unfortunately, we didn't realize that there was only 1 bathroom in the large suite (we were expecting 2 bathrooms). When we communicated our disappointment to the owner, she stated that the website very clearly states that all of their suites only have 1 bath. I beg to differ. Under the description of the large two bedroom, the quantity of bathrooms isn't even mentioned. The owner did try to appease us by offering another suite the next night (for an additional cost, of course). However, we were already feeling disgruntled over the entire situation. Being that there were no additional rooms available for the first night of our stay, 2 of our party moved to an alternate hotel. I rated this hotel higher based on its proximity to local amenities within Vancouver (Stanley Park, Robson St. and many eateries). But, the hotel itself failed to impress me. It was passable, but there were too many little annoyances to make our money spent worthwhile. For instance, the alleyway leading into the parking lot is creepy and dirty. You need to drive by dumpsters to access it. The room keys do not easily fit into the doorlocks so you're stuck standing out in the hallway jiggling the door so that the key fits. There is no central a/c in the rooms. On our final day, we asked about checkout procedures and were told to just leave our keys in the room. Well, we needed the garage door opener to get out of the facility so we had to run back up to drop off the keys after driving out. Way inconvenient!! If I were in desperate need of a room in Vancouver, I would stay here again to avoid sleeping out back in their dumpsters with the transients. Otherwise, I'd go elsewhere to get my money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful City - BUT DON'T STAY AT TIMES SQUARE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: UKIEinTORONTO
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a one week stay in Vancouver city and we are still wondering how we got fooled into making reservations and staying at Times Square. Their web-site is completely misleading and the only reviews that gave a good description of the hotel are the negative ones. I am serious. The rooms are dirty and smell and the furniture is outdated . Maid service takes place every 3 days. I had a few issues about the size and cleanliness of the room and lack of central air conditioning and I went to the small business room on the 3rd floor to speak to the hotel manager and was told that she was not available but would contact me within the next few hours. Nobody ever did call me back. This hotel definitely lacks in customer service - I guess their policy of paying for your full hotel stay upon check-in allows them to treat their guests poorly since we have no choice but to stay there or else risk losing our money if we want to check-out early because of the poor conditions. If you're travelling with kids I would be very concerned for your safety - when we were returning from dinner one evening we entered the underground parking garage and found a homeless person walking in the private parking lot - we quickly ran into the building. There are many affordable hotels conveniently located in downtown Vancouver city - our friends had a wonderful experience at the Westin Bayshore - but if you're looking to stay at a high-end hostel, then Times Square Suites is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Awsome service!!”
Reviews.Author: chrissyv
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel!! We felt like we lived there. They even put our name on the door buzzer where you come in. We stayed for three nights, with our 2 young children. The front desk was very helpful with directions or anything we needed. The room had everything even a small stereo. It was very clean, no bugs! Easy walk to stanley park and the beach, nice neighbourhood. Would stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place- Times Square Suites”
Reviews.Author: Sheila_from_Edmonton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have travelled all over the world, and we decided to visit Vancouver, BC for a week. I must say after reading all the wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor and seeing that Times Square Suites was ranked the #2 hotel ( #1 in my opinion) out of 103 we decided to try it out. Our experience was fantastic! Our flight was delayed and we did not show up in Vancouver until 1:00 am, we had called ahead to inform the hotel of our delay and see if it was possible to check in late. To my surprise the manager greeted us at 1:00am and checked us in to our room, at no other hotel have I ever received that degree of customer service. Not only was the staff and management wonderful, the room was unlike any other we have stayed in. We chose the standard one bedroom with a balcony. It wasn’t like any other hotel rooms where there is barely enough space to put your luggage, this room was large, like an apartment, with a full kitchen, laundry in suite, large bedroom, dressers, 2 TV and a stereo. I was amazed at the cleanliness of the suite and the building. We rented a car and it was great to be able to park in the secure underground parking, which is hard to find in Vancouver. I love the location of Times Square Suites because it was so close to all amenities and sites, plus the staff recommended a few places we had not thought of. You can walk up Robson Street and shop, or walk 10 mins to beautiful Stanley Park, everything was right beside the hotel. I recommend the Tapastree restaurant (same building) which has wonderful food and is one of my new favourite restaurants. Of all the hotels I have vistied, Times Square Suites is my new favorite place to stay. Sheila - Edmonton, AB

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mersimbo
Reviews.Content: Gee, reading the last two reviews makes me wonder if there is a Times Square Suites in a parallel universe. We stayed here Aug. 1-3 prior to taking a cruise and thought everything was terrific! Our suite, situated toward the rear, was very clean and quiet. We had a one bedroom plus den without a balcony, and it was very nice for 3 adults. My husband and I had the bedroom, where the bed was a queen-size as we had been told. My mom, 88, had her choice of either the convertible sofa in the living room or the single bed in the den. She opted for the den and loved it, although the "den" isn't all that much larger than twice the size of the bed. Windows all around kept her from feel hemmed in and having her own space gave her privacy. The den would also be great for a child. We had no problem with the airconditioning. We put a verticle oscillating fan in the bedroom doorway and the whole place stayed comfortable. We loved being able to make our own breakfast every morning (yea for Safeway) and the dishwasher was a pleasant surprise. We had take-out pizza one night up on the roof garden - a wonderful place complete with a gas grill and picnic supplies for those who want to something other than take-out. For other meals, the area just bristles with interesting restaurants. We found the location to be very convenient to most everything we wanted to see. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We were emailed prior to our arrival warning us that we were arriving on a "fireworks" night and that the area would be crowded. This turned out to be true - what a mass of humanity - but we slowly made our way to the Times Square to a warm welcome. Even had our name on the room listing outside. When we left, our bags were put in the luggage room until we needed them, at which time the staff made sure that our cab picked us up at the back (garage) entrance - even running around the building to make sure that the cab found us in a timely manner. We could not have asked for any better service. In the Times Square, we felt that we'd found a "gem" of a place and would go back anytime we're even near Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Don"t Get Trapped”
Reviews.Author: LOVETOTRAVEL048
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vacouver city on August 6th after having spent the first 6 days of our family vacation in Whistler. My husband booked a large two bedroom at the Times Square based on reviews from TripAdvisor and the hotel website. Our 3 children were travelling with us. I had my first doubts about the hotel selection when I reviewed their confirmation letter which stated that full payment is made upon arrival - not check-out. The room we received did not have a king size bed as we requested and was rather small for a family of 5. Upon entering the room all the portable fans were turned on and circulating a very stale ,unfresh air. The web-site is VERY!!! misleading with respect to room size and it does not mention that the building lacks central air. During the summer months it is very hot in the evening. On our first night no one was able to sleep and the pillows smelled awful - I had to wrap them with bath towels. When we expressed our concerns and told the front desk (a small office on the 3rd floor) that we wanted to check out - the clerk said fine, but you will still be responsible for the full stay . We asked to speak to the building owner/manager - Irene Roy - but were told that she would be in the next day and would call us first thing in the morning. At this point, we felt frustrated and trapped and were not willing to loose $1000.00. The owner never called us and I later learned that she lives at Times Square. Our view was the back of the building facing several dumpsters and an alley. Each morning my daughters and I had the pleasure of being awaken by the garbage trucks and a view of transients searching through the garbage bins. I could go on and on , just don't rely on the web-site and save your families from having to sleep in rooms that make you wonder if that's mould your smelling. BUYER BEWARE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferLynn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay at Times Square Suites. We were in a one bedroom suite and it was absolutely perfect for the two of us. Just enough room to have space, but not too big. We loved having the kitchen in that it enabled us to save a few dollars each day by making our own breakfast. We also loved the fact that we had our own washer/dryer in the unit. That was a huge lifesaver because it allowed us to bring half the clothes we needed to. The hotel couldn't be better located - in my eyes. We were literally at the corner of Robson and Denman - which are two great streets to be on. I know in some of the other posts, it mentioned that certain units had a lot of street noise, but we really didn't find that to be true and we were facing Denman - near Robson. I was concerned about it (after reading the posts), but even with our windows opened, the only thing we heard from the street was the beeping of the street lights occasionally - and even that wasn't bad or distracting. And I really don't believe having a higher floor would alleviate that. We were on the second floor, and I don't think being on the fourth floor would have mattered much. We did utilize the parking and while we had to pay $12/night, I believe that was probably comprable to other hotels. The only real issue I had was the Air Conditioning and that wasn't too big of a deal. There is only one AC unit in the hotel unit and it's in the bedroom and the first night - even with it on - I was quite hot. And it wasn't even that hot outside. The next night, we tried having the AC on full blast and shutting the bedroom door part way and that helped. By the third night, we shut the door the full way, and it was better. What was weird was that during the day (with the AC going in the bedroom), it was downright cold, but at night, it just didn't get as cold in the bedroom. They had extra humidity controls in the hotel unit, but we weren't sure how to use them, so we left them alone. They also had plenty of fans in the hotel unit, so we fully utilized them. The maids were great and the unit was spotless each day. Check-in and check-out was easy. Just had to check-in before you parked your car in the garage and check-out after you left the garage. All in all a beautiful hotel that was so close to Robson/Denman, Stanley Park and the waterfront. My husband and I walked everywhere - even to Gastown/Chinatown from our location. I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family!”
Reviews.Author: YSJ74
Reviews.Content: Before and after my family Alaskan cruise, 25 of us stayed at Times Square Suites. Excellent choice! Rooftop BBQ (covered ceiling in case of rain, comfortable lounges, a nice grill) was SO MUCH FUN! Safeway just across the street. Short walk to Stanley park, English bay, Robson st shopping area. 1 bedroom suite was big enough for around 10 people gathering. Laundry/dryer very useful after cruise. Friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Tripper183
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Times Square Suites for 4 nights in July. Room was very clean and generally well maintained. Fantastic location. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. We loved Vancouver and would happily stay at the TSS again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT for our young family”
Reviews.Author: z_portland
Reviews.Content: Thank you Trip Advisor! We booked this unsure what to expect, but it was perfect for us. Its basically an apartment building, which was great. We have two 4 yr olds and the one bedroom unit provided some privacy, comfort, great little kitchen, perfect location, etc. Safeway close, which was excellent to get breakfast & lunch supplies. Pretty quiet building considering location. Close to shops, great eating, and the park. And a great price. I was surprised by the parking charge, but it was secure. Staff was fine. We will be going back here, but maybe we'll splurge on the 2 bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Suite - Just Added Maid Service”
Reviews.Author: RenSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here and loved the location. So close to Stanley park and bicylce rentals and the waterfront. Further up Robson so as not too crowded. Great little neighborhood restaurants, grocery stores and shops surrounding. The suite was very clean and spacious enough for a family of four. Parking/check-in is a little more complicated than at a regular hotel, but definitely worth it. (You have to send someone up through security to check-in, then they give you keys to parking in the back. - Parking on the street is fairly difficult.) Currently they are doing some maintenence on the windows outside, but it should be finished soon. They just added optional daily maid service for their short-term guests at no charge. Great choice for longer-term stays.

Reviews.Title: “awesome digs, best location in town...”
Reviews.Author: bajabob
Reviews.Content: had a great stay at the Times Square suites, stayed 2 nights in the 2 bedroom suite. SUPER COMFY beds and awesome pillows. Frig, microwave, washer and dryer. Only problem was the suite only had one bathroom which was tough with 5 people. Nice staff

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with kids! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: beetle123
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4-- 2 adts and 2 chd stayed for 3 nights before a cruise. It was wonderful. The room was so clean and the staff was very nice and helpful. We ate at the boathouse near English Bay Beach the first night at the recommendation of the hotel. It was so nice. We used the Safeway for some drinks and snacks. We would walk the streets in the early evening and it was no trouble to find a place to eat. We ate at a place called Nats for pizza one night. It was the best pizza we ever had. We rented a car and drove to Grouse Mountain and Whistler. Both were great. We went zip-ling in Whistler--try it! I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. Having the private bedroom and 2 TVs with kids was great. We also made use of the washer/dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: tia22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights starting June 19. We stayed in a 1 BR suite (303) and found it extremely clean and quiet. The room had a small balcony that had a view of Robson Street. The furniture and linens were in great shape and nothing showed any signs of needing replacement. The fully equipped kitchen was great. Walk another block past Safeway and you will find a much better food store (Capers) with a full deli and bakery and much better prices. The staff was very helpful in answering questions about sights to see and the transit system. We easily found our way to Grouse Mountain by taking the bus and ferry. The hotel's location is fantastic. It’s an easy walk to Stanley Park and the beach at English Bay. We brought drinks up to the roof deck several nights to relax after a day of sightseeing. The roof has views of the mountains. There are tons of places to eat right on Denman Street. The hotel staff made some good dining recommendations too. If you are there on a Monday, have lunch at the Pacific Culinary Institute at the entrance to Granville Island. The food was fantastic and it’s 2 for 1 on Mondays (three courses for $26). Also, the Tourist Center on Burrard St. offers discount tickets to all attractions. If you have time, order the Entertainment Book online for Vancouver. It’s packed with 2 for 1 tickets. It cost us $24 but saved us $77. I would stay at Times Square again without any hesitation. The hotel is clean, safe and the staff is friendly and helpful. It was a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.....”
Reviews.Author: Cilgwyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Times Square Suites for two nights at the beginning of May. The staff were very helpful and friendly and, although the apartment was smaller than I had expected after viewing the website, it was extremely well equipped and very clean. I had reserved a one bedroomed apartment with den and we were very pleased to have the extra room in the den as we were able to store all our luggage in there (we had been travelling for three weeks by this time). It would have been rather crowded in the living room otherwise and there was certainly no space in the bedroom to store very much at all. However there was plenty of closet space and we were very glad to have our own washing machine and dryer in the apartment. The bed was comfortable as was the furniture in the living area. Our room was at the front of the building but we were not troubled by traffic noise unduly and as it was warm and sunny we were able to open up the doors to the (minute) balcony and enjoy the air. The roof terrace is on the small side but the BBQ and equipment up there was spotlessly clean and the views were wonderful. The apartments are extremely well situated - within walking distance of downtown and having a Safeway supermarket and a large deli (Capers) close by so if you wish to self-cater it isn't a problem. There are several cafes close by for breakfast. It is an easy walk to Stanley Park or down to the waterfront for an evening stroll and to watch the float planes take off and land. We enjoyed our stay there and would certainly return there on future visits as we prefer the feeling of independence we get from staying in such apartments to the hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms not amazing, but ok.”
Reviews.Author: Cameron85
Reviews.Content: Well after reading all the positive reviews on trip advisor and viewing the times square website and taking the virtual tour of all the suites of the hotel, along with the location right next to Stanley Park, I instantly thought this would be something special. It was a good experience, but I was expecting much more. The pictures on the website of the rooms are extremely misleading, we were in a large 2 bedroom suite, which in reality was quite small and the roof top patio was again alot smaller than what it looked like in the pictures provided. The rooms were fairly good, tv had alot of channels, staff gave us an ethernet cable and internet connection which was fast and overall the rooms were fairly good, apart from being a little too hot at night. the beds were OK, but i've slept in many better. The location is outstanding, right next to two of my favourite parts of Vancouver, Coal Harbour and Stanley Park. Very small walk to Stanley Park, great fun walking around this great Urban oasis watching the passing parade, Specatular views everywhere...and very close also to the stunning Harbour front suburb of Coal Harbour with its panoramic views accross the harbour, Stanley Park to the North Shore Mountains. There were not many decent restaurants close to the Hotel, and there wern't too many cafes, and theywere quite poor compared to those back home in Australia. Vancouver is an outstandingly beautiful city and I wouldn't hesitate to return, but may end up choosing different accommodation next time...however times square really does have a great location, and the rooms were decent enough to not annoy us, but I did expect a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and fabulous room!!”
Reviews.Author: maighdlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Times Square Suites over memorial day weekend with our 2 year old daughter. I booked the room from the hotel's website and requested a room on the back side of the hotel, as we needed it quiet at night to keep the little one asleep. We had read other travelers' reviews that the streetside rooms were noisy. When we checked in, we realized not only were we given a room on the back side of the building, but we were also given a studio with a den for the price of a studio, which was nice. At check in, the reception was quick and friendly. I asked about a good Indian restraunt, and the gentleman recommended India Bistro, which was FABULOUS! Yummy food. He gave me a map, showed me where it was and also pointed out a few other landmarks. The building was very clean and felt very secure, as you had to use a key to get into the front door, and a key to open the elevator. We paid for parking, which is a must, as there is no street parking anywhere around. The parking garage was very secure and there's another keyed entry to the foyer with the elevator. Our room was immaculately clean and was much bigger than we had expected! It had a sleeper sofa, a fireplace, a dining table with four chairs, a tv/dvd combo, microwave, fridge, dishes, dishwasher, coffee pot w/coffee and condiments, electric teapot, iron/board and a full size washer and dryer! There was tons of closet space as well!! We felt like we had our own little flat in Vancouver, it was great! Plus, there was lots of room for our little one to spread out with her toys and gear. There was a nice little den/sunroom off of the living room that had chairs. We also had a powerful AC, which was handy, as it was a pretty warm weekend. The bed was very comfortable and had really nice sheets and a fluffy duvet. We never heard a sound from anyone else around us, or from outside the entire time we were there. It was very quiet and pleasant. The location is amazing! It is walking distance to Stanley Park and all of the great things you can do there, plus there are coffee shops, grocery stores and restraunts all around you within a couple of blocks. Also, as a last note.....they were doing some repairs to the windows on the back side of the building. There was a note on the table in the room informing us of this upon check in. They apologized for any noise or inconvenience ahead of time. However, we didn't hear anything or feel inconvenienced at all. We didn't even notice they were working on anything, really. But, when we got home, we had an email with 20% off for our next stay for the 'inconvenience'! It was very thoughtful and generous, we thought! We will definitely be staying here again! We loved everything about this little home away from home in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Supreme Goddess
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in May 2007... All the great reviews already posted here are all accurate. The location was excellent; walking distance to Stanley Park and great area for runners/walkers. The Running Room store is on the same block if you need supplies. Several great restaurants and coffee shops within a short walking distance, as well as a grocery store across the street. Service and security were both of the highest standards. When I had trouble locating the main entrance when we arrived, the staff offered to come down from the office and meet me on the street! Our suite had everything we needed. When I booked the room, I requested the most quiet room possible, and we were accomodated with a room in the back. The building was very quiet and the room was very clean. Only two things I would point out: the elevator is extremely slow at times; and when we checked in, we weren't informed that our suite door didn't automatically lock on its own (so our door was unlocked for the first few days). However these two things were minimal, and didn't lessen the excellent quality and experience. Will definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, be aware in hot weather”
Reviews.Author: JA/IRBolton
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days, service from staff was great and friendly. Room met our expectactions and very clean and had comfortable furnishings and well equipped. The only negative comments are noise levels in the early hours bin men empting bins at 8am each day and the rooms needs to have better air con our room was far to warm as the hot water heater was in a cupboard in our room and it was only 17c outside. So in the summer months the room would be far to warm. In the cooler months the accomadation would be fantastic ,lovely fire in the lounge and heating in the bedrooms. Yes I would use again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely apartment”
Reviews.Author: fcchelsea
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked the Times Square Suites as a result of reading reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. The location is excellent for both the downtown and for the fabulous Stanley Park. We had a hire car but didn't use it apart from a trip out to the airport. Everywhere else we went was on foot. The rates are also extremely reasonable when compared to downtown hotels. The property itself is very unassuming from the outside and does not have a traditional hotel lobby. Access to the suites is via a lift straight from the street door. Our suite was on the third floor at the back (as we had requested) and was really very nice. It was the type of place that we wouldn't actually mind living in !! The fully equipped kitchen was a real bonus and the furnishings were all of a high quality. Although the living room looked out over a parking lot there were also views of the mountains in the distance. If there is one slight criticism it is that the desk staff could have been slightly more forward in giving information on things such as how your key operates the lift and how to access the car park. Having said that this is a very minor gripe and we would certainly consider staying here again when next in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: happytravels25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Times Sqaure about three different times over the course of our holiday to Canada, and I must say on each occasion we were very impressed with the place. The rooms are very large , tastefully furnished, amazingly well equipped and spotlessly clean - we thought it brilliant value for money! We also found that the location of the hotel was perfect for exploring Vancouver. Would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandy12
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one Saturday night in one bedroom suite. Room 404 had a fireplace , small balcony, full kitchen, dining room table, sofa and chair and tv in living room and another in bedroom. room was claen and very nice. they have a special till end of April so room was only 119 canadian. Want to return. On the roof was a really nice barbeque and table and chairs so you can also cook there. When arrive at hotel buzz front desk on intercom and they will release door lock for you and ride elevator to third floor to check in. Since we were only there for 1 day we ate out. Really liked Ukrainian village restaurant just around corner on Denman and a fish and chip place Mr something can't remember name on Denman but did not like breakfast at De Dutch. We took train and then skytrain and then Robson bus #5. It did not take very long maybe 15 min. We were going to take a taxi but line was very long. I think it was about 4.50 canadian for both of us to get to hotel. When we checked out at 11 am train was not leaving till 6pm so we left our daybag at hotel till we needed to go to train station. We got a all day pass at safeway store (about 1/2 block from hotel) for 8 dollars per person and took seabus and used buses for touring then back to hotel to get day bag and go to train station . Safeway also has atm machine. Great trip. Hotel was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Amchja
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Times Square Suites based on recommendations from TripAdvisor, and were very pleased. Although not your traditional hotel (no formal lobby per se, more like a condo/apartment), the room was large and immaculate. We'd have paid 3 times as much for a room of that size and quality at one of the major hotel chains. The location was very convenient - close to Stanley Park, and with a variety of restaurants and shopping within walking distance. We especially liked the excellent tapas restaurant right next door and the breakfast joint that serves very fresh and reasonably priced food right across the way. Although we only stayed one night, there was a Safeway a block away, and we'd have shopped there for food to cook in our full kitchen if we had a longer stay. The beds were luxurious and super comfortable - my son even commented that the sofa bed that he slept on was exceptionally comfortable, and that is rarely the case with sofa beds! We won't look any further on our next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “We Liked Our Cozy Apartment”
Reviews.Author: wonderfulworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place March 16-17, 2007. Our one-bedroom apartment was on the back of the building--away from the street. We slept with the window open, and it was quiet except for the sound of crows one morning. This is not a hotel in the usual sense. It is more like an apartment building with no lobby and a small office on the 3rd Floor. We have stayed in Vancouver several times at Hotel Vancouver and at the Sutton Place Hotel. We prefer the location of those hotels; however, we also liked at the Times Square Suites having a living room, a full kitchen, and a bedroom. Our king bed was comfortable and the apartment was very well maintained. It rained one entire day of our stay. It was nice to go home in the afternoon and read in front of the fireplace. (Which are out of service May-September according to a note in the room.) This would be an ideal place to stay with children. It is a short walk from the sea wall. There is a Safeway across the street and nearby many restaurants, ranging from pizza joints to fine dining (Raincity Grill, etc.). There is no ice machine. We purchased ice from the Safeway for $2.99. I found the operation to be professional. I booked the room over the telephone and received a confirmation by e-mail. When we arrived my name was on the directory next to the inter-com system at the entry. The staff was kind and friendly and they gave helpful answers to our questions about restaurants and other matters. In summary: This is more like an apartment than a hotel. Our room was on the back of the building, and I would not book a room on the street side. The set-up is particularly suitable for families and for people who are in town on business for an extended period. The location is perfect if you prefer to be in a neighborhood than in the center of the commercial district (which is walkable but about a mile away).

Reviews.Title: “We love Time Square Suites”
Reviews.Author: mygr8visits
Reviews.Content: My home away from home Time Square Suites. I have stayed in this fantastic property at least two to three times a year for the past 10 years and have only positive things to say about it. The staff at Time Square are professional, friendly and very customer service oriented. I appreciate the fact I am in a boutique all suites hotel that caters to both long term and short term stays. The suites are impecably clean and very homey with a full kitchen for those who enjoy eating at home a bit throughout a longer stay. I have stayed up to three weeks at this property and have always looked forward to my return. The new beds are a dream with the white duvet covers and tons of pillows. The building is situated on Robson and Denman and on the outskirts of the world famous Stanley Park....the hussle and bussle is an added feature to our stay in Vancouver. I found the suites very comfortable and experienced no difficulty at all adjusting to my new lively and active surroundings. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. This area is famous for its shopping, resturants and close proximity to almost everything including English Bay (where the fireworks display is held in late July and August), Stanley Park, The Vancouver Aquarium, Robston Street (everyone knows that street) The Vancouver Art Gallery and so much more. The building is secure, but not impersonal like the larger hotels around. The Building Manager runs the property like it's her very own, taking care to the details that customers notice. In summation, Time Square Suites in number 1 in my book and I wouldn't stay anywhere else when I'm in town.!

Reviews.Title: “BUYER BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: herbtibbs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Times Square Suites for 3 nights in early September after reading the rave reviews on Trip Advisor. We were sorely dissapointed by all aspects of our stay. For starters, the "front desk staff" if you could call them that, were rude and extremely dissorganized. They initially had no record of our reservation, but conveniently found it after searching at length through folders for the piece of paper that contained our reservation....for a whopping $189 per night do they not have a computerized reservation system?? Although we had requested a King Bed, they had no record of this either! Our "QUIET" room, faced out to Denman Street (a booming traffic district, oozing with homeless degenerates). No apologies were made for these grave errors, instead we were made to feel lucky to even get a room. The room was sweltering as our "air conditioning" unit, was a window mounted unit located in the bedroom. I could barely breathe, and my asthma was out of control. Although they claim to be a non pet friendly facility, I found several pet hairs on the sofa and chair. YUCK! On our second night, as we were leaving for dinner, I was shooshed in the hallway by the building maintenance supervisor, Irene Roys, as I recieved a very important business call on my cell phone. I found this to be extremely unprofessional especially as she was clad in a robe and bare feet AND they claim to cater to the business clientele. I would never send my business clients to stay in such an establishment. We need to be able to carry out our business when the time calls for it. I have stayed at the Westin Bayshore many, many times, and I regret my decision to try the Times Square! If you are looking for lousy service, outdated furnishings, and a lock down facility, this is the place for you! BUYER BEWARE, once they have your money, (you pay in full up front, before you see the room) you won't get it back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location without a View”
Reviews.Author: NLcoach
Reviews.Content: The location of the suite was perfect if you are doing alot of walking and sightseeing. Quiet, safe, and clean with plenty of restaurents and grocery stores nearby. Underground parking and a secure enterance and elevator made you feel safe. Lots of foot traffic near the hotel so you are never alone. The room was spacious for our family of 4 however we did not have a view. There was not a window in the living area. Only the bedroom and the den (second room that fit a single bed and that was it). Felt a little closed in when in the living room because of no windows but again we didn't spend alot of time at the suite. Very clean and I would book there again. We were there 10 days and we loved the location. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay at Times Square Suites -- still great”
Reviews.Author: dinolicious
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Times Square right before Christmas and it was a very good experience. Everything was in order, no problems checking in/out, room was VERY clean. For the ammmenties you get the price is excellent. I got a room without a view and the small balcony looked out over the parking lot but it didn't bother us since we were out most of the day. I really enjoyed my stay and highly recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could wish for!”
Reviews.Author: Penselwood
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Times Square Suites. The staff could not be more friendly. The quality of the rooms really stood out. There was a wonderful kitchen and plenty of space. The location is just a little away from the centre of things but everything is within easy walking distance. We hired a car and travelled up to Whistler and Jasper and then down to Seattle. It was just a great relaxing time. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Times Square Suites”
Reviews.Author: travelpassion
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed here for a 3-night city break as part of a bigger tour of BC, WA and OR. We loved the suite, it was spacious and well appointed at a very reasonable cost. Due to a 23 hour flight delay from the UK we did not arrive at the Suites until the morning after our intended time. I had contacted reception and warned them off and I was delighted when on arrival the receptionist told me that the manager had waived the fee for the previous night - nice touch. We had a 1-bedroomed suite with a den which was fitted with a single bed on our request. The suite was spacious with an excellent kitchen area and the added bonus of a tumble dryer and washer - just what a family needs when on a tour of Canada and the USA. We spent the last 3 nights of our holiday here and it was very handy being able to get our washing done in the convenience of our own room, prior to going home. I think the location is great, minutes from Stanley Park with a small supermarket and numerous restaurants on your doorstep. The walk into the centre of Vancouver is quite long but also quite enjoyable and local bus services stop close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Long2Travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night prior to going on a cruise and loved the hotel. I look forward to returning to Vancouver and Times Square Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: ares_research
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Times Square Suites and had a wonderful time. If you are looking for your typical hotel, this is not the place for you. No one is going to park your car or take your bags up to your room. Personally, I don't need that because I prefer not to tip every Tom, Dick and Harry. The staff I did see were very friendly. Our room was incredible. It overlooked Robson St. and I could not hear the outside. They were doing construction around the hotel, but that didn't bother us. Things are very secure there. I'm not sure if they've had problems in the past, but the area seemed very nice and safe to me. Yes, there are homeless people, but what major city doesn't have homeless people? They seemed pretty harmless to me. The location was excellent--very close to Stanley Park and close to shopping. There are a lot of cafes and restaurants in the area. Moreover, there is a safeway directly across the street. We also took advantage of the free gym membership while we stayed there. If you have small kids I recommend the bedroom/den. We put our kids in the den and we slept in the other room.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Oz_Kiwi7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week as a base to explore Vancouver. All staff were warm & helpful. The one bedroom apartment was well appointed with a full kitchen that allowed us to save money on meals. The location is great, on the edge of Stanley Park & a 10 minute uphill walk to the main area of Robson St. There is a Safeway nearby & several lovely cafes & restaurants. I can not recommend these suites highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home - Times Square suites”
Reviews.Author: 2wombats
Reviews.Content: Warm and friendly welcome at reception. Suite well equipped almost didn't want to leave as a home away from home. Great eating close by. Convenient to Stanley Park and nice harbour walks. We had a back suite which was quiet. Exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ringo99
Reviews.Content: We chose Times Square Suites based on Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The rooms were well maintained, extremely clean, well-stocked and it was great to have a kitchen and laundry facilities in the unit as we were there for one week. The location is excellent though the hotel itself a little hard to find (and I'm from Vancouver!) because it was former apartment building and the signage is somewhat hidden from the main road. The standard one bedroom and den (with balcony) is said to accommodate up to 4 adults but I think that would have been too cramped for a long stay, especially since we had two young kids with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great self contained accommodation in perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller20
Reviews.Content: Very nice very clean self contained apartment in a perfect location. Security very good, rooms soundproof and airconditioned. Laundry facilities were fantastic for a long (9 days) stay. Located on the border between Stanley park and downtown Vancouver, and at the junction of two great streets - Robson (straight to shopping) and Denman (straight to beach). A short walk along the boardwalk to the overseas ship terminal and the information centre. Internet access, bike hire, supermarket and restaurants around the corner. We really enjoyed this very reasonably priced (cheaper than equivalent quality hotel) apartment, and would stay there again if we go back to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: easttown
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Times Square Suites in early Oct. What a great find in Vancouver! We had a 1 bedroom suite and loved having a full kitchen and washer/dryer right in the room. Even though it was still warm outside, we couldn't resist the gas fireplace in the living room area. The kitchen is equipped with everything you could possibly need. There is a Safeway grocery store just a block away if you want to pick up groceries. There are plenty of restaurants, cafes and shops within walking distance. It is a great location. This property is very well maintained. We were impressed with their attention to safety. There is secured parking underneath the building with a automatic garage door. If you are visiting Vancouver make sure to visit the Vancouver Aquarium and Stanely Park which also are close to this property. We would love to go back to Vancouver and spend more time at the Times Square Suites..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Depending”
Reviews.Author: OregonJoe
Reviews.Content: Family stayed at the Time Square Suites in early September due to the reviews on this website. We found the hotel to be as described in all of the reviews that we had read. Clean, secure and with a friendly/accomodating staff. For location, if you are planning to spend time at Stanley Park this is a great spot, however, it is a walk to the downtown shoping areas and on the tail end of Robson Street where many of the shops are lacking. I would recommend this hotel for those traveling to VanCouver for a few days with plans to explore the park and waterfront. If your a first time vistor to VanCouver and only have a short stay planned, I would recommend a hotel more in the center of the conference/retail area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: London1001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Times Square for two nights in August which was great. The only issue we had with them, which was quite a big one, was that we had booked to return for one night at the end of our trip, and they stated that they had "overbooked" and moved us to the Lord Stanley instead (which was terrible). I was really disappointed that we had booked so far in advance and still got moved, although they did give us a $50 voucher for the tapas restaurant downstairs, which is great by the way! The suite itself is very well appointed, although the bed was the smallest we stayed in whilst in Canada, and the aircon isn't great if you are going mid-summer - it's really noisy so you can't leave it on whilst you sleep. Location is OK, a bit of a walk up the hill to the main strip of Robson St; but for the price, this place is exceptionally good value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Time Square Suites”
Reviews.Author: Roxette-Australia
Reviews.Content: We loved our 2 night stay, and if we were able to, would have stayed a week. The suite was very comfy, including the bed, and as we were just arriving in Canada after a long trip from Australia, really appreciated the whole Time Square Suites experience. We walked to the restaurants in Denman Street - 5 mins, to the Internet cafe around the corner - 2 mins, to beautiful Stanley Park - 10 mins, and to the great Boathouse Restaurant overlooking English Bay - an easy 15 min walk to the end of Denman. The bus stop was just a short walk and we were able to catch a bus to both the main shopping areas and also to Granville Island. We booked times Square Suites after reading all the great reviews on Trip Advisor, and were not disappointed in the accomodation or position. Would definitely stay there again, and recommend this property without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, but!!”
Reviews.Author: royt5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I picked this hotel from the many good reviews on Tripadvisor. It was squeaky clean, but I will have to say that the room we had was pretty warm. It had a small a/c but it really didn't do much. We did open the windows at night and that helped. On the day that we got to Vancouver, we went for a tour of Stanley Park, as it wasn't time to check into the hotel yet. While we were there, my wife stepped off of a curb the wrong way and cracked a small bone in her foot. It turned out that they were able to put a walking boot on her, but it still was very painful when she walked. While she was at the hospital, I ran to Times Square to check us in, and requested that we be given a room close to the elevator, but he would make no effort to swap out rooms, as he said that he was completely sold out. I know that everyone hadn't checked in, and just thought that he could swap out rooms. I thought that this was a little unprofessional. Anyway, we made it, and did have a room toward the back of the building on the 2nd floor, where the noise was not bad at all.. In conclusion, I probably would not stay at this hotel again. I think the first impressions put a little bad taste in my mouth about not making any kind of effort on changing the rooms. Also, the temperature of the room was not good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Relaxing and safe place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Gareth66
Reviews.Content: I liked the TimeSquareSuites very much. The bonus of renting the apartment is the space, the laundry, and the 24 hour assistance at the office. The apartments are very clean, and the beds are comfortable. It is a very relaxing place to stay. I stayed on a 2nd floor apartment on Robson, and I did find it noisy ( would have liked to open the windows more), but didn't really spoil my stay there. The only thing I will say is that the rooms are incredibly warm. There seems to be some sort of gas fire that is on standby, or maybe it was that my flat was above some form of boiler or something. But it was incredibly warm and dry. I didn't dare turn any heating on. The supplied fans, and basic Aircon machines helped though. So not all bad. I did request an apartment at the back, but didn't get this. But I didn't push for it either. I am sure they would have accommodated. The area is good, although urban, if you are used to cities then it won't be a problem. Easy reach of everywhere, and in a safer more interesting part of town. Vancouver is generally a safe place, and try to feel compassion for the homeless rather than derision. They rarely bother anyone. Areas to avoid are east hastings street between china town and gastown, rather a dodgy area that. Take a taxi if you need to visit there. It's at the other end of Vancouver so nowhere near TSS. Shopping and eating is endless, and Canadians are polite and friendly, they will make you feel at home. Stanley park is around the corner and is very safe, you can walk up from the hotel along the shoreline to Canada place. Get yourself a airboat to Victoria, quite cheap and quite different. I highly recommend TSS. And it's good decour, and safe calm atmosphere. With very friendly and helpful staff. Lots of tourist brochures, and endless assistance if needed. Just relax, don't panic, and stay chilled as the Canadians do in the very enjoyable city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and so convenient”
Reviews.Author: megacl
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in Times Square for 3 nights and had a great time. Is was within walking distance of everything. We enjoyed having our kitchen and laundry, which was great, to pack lunches for Stanley Park and other adventures. The in-suite laundry definitely was a plus, it was nice going home with clean clothes and not having to worry. Yes it was noisey, but that's expected, due to the nature of the apartment complex and the busyness of Vancouver. To be honest, once the windows were closed you could hardly hear anything. As it is like an apartment, it was nice not having anyone come in and distrub our "home" and all other policies were laid out in the booklet they provide in your room. We definitely did a have a great experience. As well, what made me feel like a real tenant and just "guest" was when I went into the office they knew who I was and our name was on the buzzer code (we only stayed 3 nights) The part that really made the end of our stay great, was they setup a cheap strech limo to the airport, it was really nice to leave in style. I will definitely be staying there again and will be recommending Times Square Suites to others

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: afx
Reviews.Content: We read about the Times Square Suites on Tripadvisor and took a chance on booking it for two nights midweek in September. We called and confirmed our room and requested a king suite. When we arrived to the 'Suites' and asked if we could get a room with a king bed, the woman at the reception asked "did we book this on the internet or did you call us because I don't believe we have any kings available and I don't see the request on your reservation". (Note: If they don't have a consistent booking policy then why is she asking how we booked it?) We were given a second floor room over Denman Street, which is very noisy and over a pizza delivery restaurant. We then asked the reception if we could have another room, perhaps on Robson Street which was a bit quieter or on a higher floor away from the traffic. The receptionist asked "Did we request a quiet room?". Of course, we wondered who wouldn't request a quiet room or perhaps there are people that stay at the 'Suites' that want the noisiest room available? Finally, we were never told until after check-in that the units are cleaned after 3 days of stay and we weren't aware that we had to remove our trash and leave it outside the doorway or it would not be removed. I never read this policy on their website nor were we told about this upon arrival. Needless to say, I would recommend another option (and there are many) in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “warning: nice appoartment but noisy...”
Reviews.Author: Hamburger_Deern
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment for 1 week. The apartment is very nice with kitchen that has everything you need. It is nicely furnished and also very clean. The only problem is that it can be very loud. Our apartment was on Robson on the 4th floor and even there you can hear the traffic. The intersection Denman/Robson is very busy. We could even hear the beeping ot fhe traffic light in our room. There is a construction work going on on the other side of the street, so there is noise coming from there, too. So make sure you request a room on Robson but be aware that it can be noisy there, too. Other than that, great apartments and great location! We recommend the Tapastree Restaurant downstairs which is the best restaurant in town for us!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: red101
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night saty in the Times Square Suites which I booked after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. We booked a 2 bedroom suite for my family (2 adults, 3 kids 10, 7 and 5) and our friends booked a 1 bedroom suite (2 adults and 2 kids, 10 and 7). It's a perfect place for families with kids, and works out good value if you have more than 4 in a family - this usually means having to book 2 rooms in a hotel which can be expensive. The staff were very helpful and discreet. We had some difficulty with one of the TV's and it was attended to within half an hour. I phoned the office to check whether there were any take-out restaurants which would deliver to Times Square (as we and our friends took it in turns to stay in and babysit all the kids), and within 10 minutes details of such places were printed and posted under our door, though we didn't actually use any of these. The decor is not fancy, but pleasant and the whole apartment was spotlessly clean. We did have an apartment which faced the parking lot, but it was quiet and you could just see the mountains! It was quite hot in the apartment, but fans were provided and there was a/c in our bedroom. Everything you could need was provided - e.g. coffee filters, and lots of towels and pillows. Wonderful location with easy access to Stanley Park and lots of restaurants (only a short stroll to the Raincity Grill, which was lovely). All in all it was perfect for us and I would not hesitate in recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “View of parking lot”
Reviews.Author: LuvVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Times Square Suites only to find ourselves having a view of a parking lot where we saw homeless people rummaging through the garbage bins day and night.
