Thought it would be a one time occurrance but it happened on a regular basis. We felt nervous driving into the underground parking lot through the back alley (where the garbage bins were). The room was basic, same as a hotel room except that they have full kitchens. We left Times Square and found another place online close by called - Signature Lux Suites. For the same money the suite was upper scale with much nicer furniture and amazing views of the harbour and mountains. The folks who run the place were very helpful, polite and courtious. We have now found our favorite place to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out at 3:00 in the morning!”
Reviews.Author: m2k
Reviews.Content: We checked into Times Square on August 20th around 1:00 in the afternoon and checked out that night at 3:00 AM. It was horrible. There is no a/c in the living area and kitchen and the window unit in the bedroom couldn't cool off the tiny bedroom. The area around the Times Square Suites is not desireable and there are signs on the front door as well as the parking garage advising you to hurry in the door and to watch behind you so that no strangers follow you in! We checked out of Times Square and into the Westin Bayshore which was lovely. The staff was extremely helpful and the room was not only 'cold' but had gorgeous views of the harbor. Would not recommend Times Square but would definitely recommend the Westin Bayshore.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't mind living here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dugard
Reviews.Content: This place is brilliant. It's so well positioned that my whole family fought over the green chair next to the window as it was the best position to people watch!! If you want something that's got a bit of life after a scenic tour of the Rockies, this is perfect. We stayed for 3 nights in August and thought it was brilliant - even two demanding teenagers thought so. From cycling around the park (early Saturday morning), walking to the tour bus stop along Robson St or walking along Coal Harbour, this is brilliant. I would happily live in this apartment block....if only I could afford to!! So it's £130 per night in high season. I'd say money well spent. Definition of a good day in Vancouver - my wife and daughter went shopping along Robson St (and beyond), my Son had some chill out time in the park (and the well positioned internet cafe three shops along) while I strolled along Coal Harbour to Canada Place, had a quiet beer and read my book while watching the world go by. Fantastic memories made all the better by Times Square and this cultured city in Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 4Canadian Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Times Square Suites for 2 nights in July. It is in an excellent location! We were within walking distance of great shopping, restaurants and Stanley Park. There are shops across the street from the hotel that rent bicycles and roller blades for very good prices. Bicycling around Stanley Park was one of the highlights of our trip. There was also a free bus around Stanley Park, but we never used it. The hotel is very secure. As another reviewer has stated, it is a little confusing when you arrive. The exterior door is locked and you have to buzz up to reception to let you in and to send the elevator to you. There is no big fancy lobby, only a small office on the second floor. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite on arrival. Our room was very spacious and comfortable. We found the room was overly air conditioned on arrival, so we turned the air conditioner lower. Our room faced the alley, so our view wasn't great. We were there for such a short time that this didn't bother us. We never had any problems with noise. The kitchen and laundry facilities within the room are wonderful to have when travelling with children. We have a teenager and he seems to take up so much room, but this hotel room was so spacious, it was wonderful. The decor was not 5 star, but it was very clean and pleasant. The bedding seemed new and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Exceptionally Clean, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: staustin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Vancouver where we stayed at Times Square Suites. Four adults shared a two-bedroom suite and we had plenty of room. The room was clean and well appointed. The weather was mild so the need for air conditioning was minimal, but only having one window unit in one bedroom could be a problem if the weather had been hotter. Our room was on the rear of the hotel, so we didn't have a problem with traffic noise, however, the view of the alley in the back wasn't the most aesthetic. Regardless, the location is great…walking distance to Stanley Park, English Bay, Coal Harbor and lots of restaurants and shopping. The staff was friendly and helpful and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “YOU MUST REQUEST A QUIET ROOM!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bpaulsen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in late July and while the room was well appointed and convenient to all the places we wished to visit, the traffic noise in our room was amazingly LOUD!! We were given a one-bedroom suite on the second floor with a balcony facing Robson. Warning:: request a room on a higher floor and away from this busy intersection! Even with a fan running full-time, we still heard tons of street noise. Also, our room had an incredibly weak air conditioner and we were very uncomfortable despite running our bedroom's air conditioner on full-blast and running the fan in the other room on high. Despite these complaints, the rest of our experiences with this particular hotel were really very positive and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family of four”
Reviews.Author: MichRee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I undertook our first road trip with our two girls, ages 4 and 7, this year and it included a stay in Vancouver. We were incredibly happy with this hotel, which is more like an extended stay corporate apartment than a hotel. With secure parking under the building, close proximity to attractions in Vancouver, and a charming room on the corner of Denman and Robson, what more could we ask for? It took less than 10 minutes to get anywhere we wanted to go in the city and there was plenty of good food within close walking distance. We stayed in the one bedroom plus den room, which worked perfectly. The bedrooms are small, but that was fine with us because we spent most of our time in the living/dining area. The bed was extremely comfortable with top quality linens and a snuggly comforter. When you consider the price and location, this is truly a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for Families and Longer Stays”
Reviews.Author: Thomjones
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Times Square Suites for 4 nights about a week ago. The hotel is well-located and is within walking distance of Stanley Park and shopping on Robson street. Beneath the hotel is a good little cafe, which serves great coffee and some decent sandwiches and breakfasts when you're in a rush. I originally went with this hotel because of the location, the kitchenette and the decent price. As well, the great reviews it has received was a definite plus. However, I was a little disappointed. The location is good, but I learned that getting around Vancouver by car is so easy that we really didn't need the premium location. As well, there were so many great looking restaurants that we never even used the kitchenette. Finally, the room was not as comfortable as I expected. Even though it was supposed to be on the quiet side of the building, we were frequently woken up by garbage trucks picking up dumpsters in the back alley. The furnishings were also stained and tired looking and the room was so hot at night that we didn't sleep well. I don't fault with the hotel staff for these facts, but I would suggest that you'd find better value in another hotel with more creature comforts. I'd suggest that it's best suited for families that are looking more for a "home" for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in late July for three nights. The room (it's not a room, it's a suite--full kitchen, family room, bedroom and bath) was VERY clean, which I am picky about, and spacious. There are a few grocery stores directly down the street, which was nice for breakfasts in (and Capers is organic, if people are picky about that). Of the three hotels we stayed in during our trip to BC, this was my husband's favorite. It was number 2 for me for just one reason: it's not really a HOTEL as much as it is a corporate apartment. This turned out to be a positive thing (and the location truly couldn't be better-close to Stanley Park and the main restaurant/shopping part of Robson), but if you want room service, your bed made every day, etc., then this isn't the place for you. However, if you want a clean, safe place to spread out and relax, eat breakfast in, and even do your laundry in your room for free before you go, then it's perfect. Would we stay here again? Absolutely. Just expect less "hotel" services (though the front desk people were great) and more of an apartment feel. I would think this would be great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Made a great vacation even better!”
Reviews.Author: lovedragonflies
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week while on vacation in Vancouver and we can't say enough about this place. The staff was not only helpful, but patient, kind and knowledgeable. They never failed to answer our many questions or offer suggestions for places to eat, shop, etc. The room was clean and nicely designed. It felt like home immediately. The location near Stanley Park, shopping, and English Bay was an extra bonus. If you are interested in staying in Vancouver, we would definitely recommend Times Square Suites! We can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: dreamholiday
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic location in Downtown Vancouver right at the bottom end of Robson Street about 5 mins from Stanley Park. We had a 2 bed apartment and it was great - full laundry facilities in your apartment which was excellent! Would have preferred a slighlty bigger apartment but it certainly was a great stop. Everything was on our doorstep. Would recommend Bojangles downstairs for your late night cappucinos. Also try Capers Organic market for food shopping - why do we not have such good facilities in the UK! Hire bikes round Stanley park but be VERY careful, we had one of ours nicked and it cost us $400! Make sure all your bikes are padlocked together in visable place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous family spot!”
Reviews.Author: BlueDevilGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Times Square Suites for one night following an Alaska cruise and absolultely loved it! We had booked a 1 BR suite, but were upgraded to a 2 BR room. We had plenty of room to spread out with our two kids. The washing machine and dryer in the apartment were a big help; off street parking was secure; staff were uniformly helpful. The neighborhood is great -- we took advantage of the Safeway, a newsagent, a great gelato place (twice!) and one of the many nearby restaurants. We greatly enjoyed being within easy walking distance of Stanley Park. My husband ran there in the morning, and later we walked to the aquarium (fabulous!), then caught the park shuttle to the public pool at Second Beach (as the hotel staff suggested). Our only regret is that we couldn't stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and management”
Reviews.Author: moo_bear
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, in a 2 bedroom apartment, for 2 nights and it was PERFECT. As everybody else has said, the accommodation is excellent and the location cannot be bettered. What's more, my friend delivered a basket and a bottle of wine and asked for it to be taken to our room to welcome us. Whoever delivered the basket and wine to the room, also set the table with wine glasses and napkins! Cannot recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Strawberry
Reviews.Content: I selected the Times Square Suites based on recommendations in the TripAdvisor forum (thank you, BCRobyn) and the reviews on this site. My three teenage kids and I stayed in a one bedroom studio at the Times Square during June 2006. What a great place for a family! We had plenty of room in our clean, well-maintained suite, allowing us to enjoy some privacy when needed. The den was more akin to a second bedroom, with its own television and a small balcony. Unlike the typical hotel room, we never felt cramped. The fully-equipped kitchen and washer/dryer came in handy. No need to haul dirty clothes home. The parking garage was convenient and secure. There is an extra charge for parking, but it is well worth it. The comfort of Times Square allowed us to fully appreciate this beautiful city - we returned with fond memories of the Stanley Park Aquarium, Dr. Sun Yat Sen Classical Chinese Garden, Lynn Canyon, shopping in the boutiques on Robson Street, and all the rest. Our suite was directly above the intersection of Robson and Denman. We enjoyed watching the activity below. We could hear some noise from traffic, but by using either the fan or the air conditioner, the sounds were completely masked. We felt completely safe in this location. No problems whatsoever when walking around the neighborhood. You should be aware that the Times Square is not a typical hotel. It is more like a small apartment building. We found the staff friendly and helpful. (We even received a thank-you note after our stay.) However, if you need a lobby, concierge, room service, pool, etc., this is probably not the place for you. Other reviewers have given favorable mention to Bojangles, the cafe on the first floor. In my opinion, Bojangles bests any hotel coffee shop. Great atmosphere, and good food at reasonable prices. Tables are available both indoors and off the sidewalk. The Times Square is within easy walking distance to countless restaurants, as well as a Safeway and Whole Foods-type grocery. There is a small independent grocer on the ground level, too. My kids and I especially appreciated the ice cream (gelato) shops in the area - a delicious reason for an evening stroll. I heartily recommend the Times Square to travelers who want clean, spacious quarters and who are willing to forego a traditional lobby and hotel layout. I'm looking forward to a return visit!

HotelInfo.Name: Times Square Suites Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1821 Robson Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6G3E4, Canada
